Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl2_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the beginning of March 2012. There was a free shuttle that picked us up from the airport to the hotel (we only waited about 5 minutes) and another shuttle that took us to the port of Miami the next morning. The room was clean except for the bad smell in the hallway on the 2nd floor (the room didn't smell). The free breakfast in the morning was AWESOME. I would definately stay here again the night before going on a cruise. We prepaid $10 per person for a shuttle to pick us up at the port and take us directly to Miami Airport which was a bad idea. We waited an hour at the port for the shuttle after having called twice and being told 20 minutes each time. I would not prepay for the shuttle. Also, the only restaurant in walking distance is Bennigans.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average Hotel but a Great Deal when Flying In and Out of Miami”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: Flew round-trip from Miami to Aruba and picked this location for their shuttle service to Miami International and the free parking for up to a week while gone. For less than $125 total, we had a king bed room with the normal amenities, free parking for the week and free shuttle to and from the airport (about 10 minutes away). The first room that they sent us to had not been cleaned. I cannot see any other reason to pick this hotel except for the parking and shuttle amenities. It is located in an industrial area next to the airport, a bit noisey with very few restaurants or shopping in the vicinity.It served our purpose and saved us parking and cab fees in excess of $100.

Reviews.Title: “Port of Miami shuttle.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganLadybug
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before a cruise. We chose this hotel for the free port of Miami shuttle. It is very close to the airport, about 10min. We did have to wait a long time to be picked up from the airport, about 40 min.But when we arrived everyone was super nice and we sighned up for the cruise shuttle(it leaves at 10 am) The room was nice and clean and the beds and pillows were comfortable.The planes are very loud and there is nothing close by but other hotels and an awful Bennigans.I would suggest ordering in pizza. All in all a nice hotel to stay for a night, though a bit overpriced but on par with other Miami hotels.

Reviews.Title: “My best option”
Reviews.Author: Starseedancer
Reviews.Content: Even that I was traveling on a tight budget, I decided to register here because i was alone and needed a safe place with free shuttle to the airport. I stayed three nights and i spent money that wasn't considered originally. Rooms were clean, with tv, cable, microwave oven and clean bathroom, they all have wi fi which was very convenient because I neded to communicate with my relatives abroad, beds were comfortable enough to assure a good sleep. Continental breakfast was enough for me to start the day. Front desk was courteous and helpful, they even helped me with a scale to weight my luggage, I also used their wake up service. Because its located near the airport, there aren't any places ( walking time ) to buy a snack or something to eat, so i used the vending machine which didn't have a great variety. If I had the money I think i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: tlanders
Reviews.Content: Used hotel before a cruise had 7 rooms booked. When I arrived room wasnt ready but they said a smoking room was available so took that one. Transportation from airport helpful and transportation to pier the next morning excellent. Breakfast in the morning very crowded not enough room. Staff friendly and helpful. Would stay again. Only downside not to much around in terms of shopping or eating.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible, slightly overpriced, but acceptable.”
Reviews.Author: The_Arden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta prior to our cruise and though the front desk service was very friendly and courteous, the overall experience did not meet our expectations for the price we paid. The reason we chose this hotel was because of the proximity to the port and for the free shuttle service to the hotel and to the pier. We were satisfied with this service. However, because the inn is literally right beside the airport, it gets to be a bit loud. Miami airport is a busy place and there are planes coming and going throughout the night. The room was average at best and I thought the bed wasn't too bad. My friend, however, woke up with a sore back. Furthermore, if free breakfast is a reason you are considering La Quinta, please reconsider. The continental breakfast (although not usually great anywhere you stay) is below standards with little variety, warm juice and weak coffee. Finally, La Quinta is located in the middle of nowhere. If you did not rent a car, expect to eat Bennigan's which is the only restaurant that is accessible by foot, unless you want to run across a 6 lane highway to get to Burger King. If you're not too picky about hotels, La Quinta is probably acceptable for a short stay before your cruise, but don't expect anything fancy, especially for what you pay. Personally, I would pick something closer to downtown like the Hilton, and pay your ten dollar fare to taxi it to the pier. It's a bit more expensive (look for a sale), but a lot more comfortable. Note: If you plan on staying at La Quinta after your cruise, and you require transportation, La Quinta offers a shuttle back to the hotel for a price. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was curtious and friendly. The hotel and room meet La Quinta spectation. They were clean overall. The hotel was a bit difficult to find since it seats back from the main road behind a closed stablishment.

Reviews.Title: “We were robbed (literally) here”
Reviews.Author: Wanda A
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this location prior and after our family Caribbean Cruise. In total we had 4 rooms booked each time. On return we checked in early and took our bags to a room because not all were ready and then headed out for a tour of the area. On returning we found that our room had been broken into (conveniently the one with ALL the bags) and jewellery/items/gifts totalling $2,000 were taken. In addition the lock on the door was faulty. Police report filed, however the hotel has not claimed any responsibility at all for the incident - to the point that they have not even COMPED one free room! The police officer said that security at this location is a problem. In addition the shuttle service is terrible to the port. Would never stay at this chain again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice for a pre-cruise hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: VTwanderlust
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at La Quinta Inn Miami Airport East for two nights preceding our cruise vacation from the Port of Miami. I was very pleased with this selection. We arrived on a Thursday night after a long drive down from Lakeland, FL. Were checked in promptly and courteously. Parking for our rental car was free. Our room was perfectly fine, two comfy beds, very clean room in all (although as other reviewers have said, the carpet could use a cleaning). Decent towels and good water pressure in the room, and the soap they provided smelled very nice. It was not a humongous room but it met our needs, not feeling cramped. The TV was newer and nice. Yes, we could hear the planes take off - frequently - but it was not deafening or bothersome, more like a background noise, and it was not a problem for us, even for my husband who is a very light sleeper. The breakfasts were fine. Nothing exotic but we didn't go away hungry. We had hard boiled eggs, cereal, coffee, bagels/cream cheese, fresh fruit, and juice. There was also a waffle machine but as we are hard core Vermonters we refuse to eat waffles or pancakes without 100% real maple syrup which of course they didn't have... so we can't say if the waffles were good or not. They have a very tiny "gym", inclusive of one treadmill, one elliptical, one recumbent bike. I did a workout on each machine - no problems although one of the pedals on the bike was partially broken. They also did not have any cleaning solution/towels located in the gym area, which was a nuisance. But it was nice to have that equipment available nonetheless. Our daughter enjoyed swimming in the pool which was nicely maintained. We had dinner one night at the next door Bennigan's and while our food was okay, service was indeed VERRRRRY SLOOOOOOOW and they do see fit to add a 15% tip to the bill - which in my opinion is stupid and they ripped themselves off because I usually tip a minimum of 20%. One downside was the airport shuttle, we returned our rental car on a Friday afternoon and waited quite a while at the airport for the shuttle to pick us up. Free, yes, but a PITA. However, one great spot was the free cruise port shuttle on Saturday AM - prompt, courteous service delivered on a giant comfy tour bus, we thought that was great. Strangely, we could not sign up for this until Friday afternoon - I was told Thursday night and Friday morning that we needed to check back after noon on Friday to sign up for Saturday's shuttle. Strange. One thing I did find peculiar was that at check in, the desk person told us to be sure NOT to order from the flyers under the door/in the hallway... scam artists. I found it unsettling that whatever sort of shady characters are allowed free reign of the hotel grounds to deliver these papers. We were not bothered by anyone... I don't understand why the hotel doesn't work harder to prevent those companies from getting in though. On Saturday morning, I realized I'd forgotten to pack my shipping tape (which I use to secure the cruise line luggage tags). Although the lobby area was mobbed with cruisers the desk staff person was kind enough to let me borrow their stapler, take it back to our room to staple the tags on. In all I would most definitely stay here again pre-cruise. Not perfect but definitely has the basic amenities and comfort required for a brief stay in the Miami area - at a much better price point than any other comparable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kydd04
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 2 days prior to my cruise and had a great time! hotel offers free airport shuttle and transportation to and from Miami port, rooms are clean wireless internet works great, also has a pool and free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Rude front desk”
Reviews.Author: Texasgirlontheroad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into this La Quinta with our corgi, Sailor, and were put on the fourth floor, nice room and very spacious. We found a La Quinta closer to a conference my husband is attending and went to inform the front desk that we would only be staying one night. Upon seeing our dog we were told dogs are not allowed on the fourth floor only the first floor. I proceeded to inform the desk clerk that when we checked in we were told there were no first floor rooms, but we could fill out a release form for our dog and take the fourth floor room. I told the desk clerk that I would like to continue what I ACTUALLY came down to the desk for and that was cancelling the next two nights. She was rude, rude, rude. Not the norm for La Quinta Inns, also neighborhood is iffy and jets taking off are deafening even in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre and post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: uniquenames
Reviews.Content: Such an awesome little hotel, with an amazing bang for our buck. Staff were INCREDIBLE! WE did two pre cruise days, and one post cruise day, and no problems at all. Breakfast was free and good. Room was clean. I loved all the free shuttles. The one night we ate at Bennigan's and the last night one of the front desk staff gave me a pamphlet for a restaurant he recommended and I have one of the best philly cheesestakes of my life. I would stay here again. Lastly, we just grabbed the bus outside of the hotel, and easily made it to south beach for 3 dollars per person. Just take the J bus

Reviews.Title: “A Little Over Priced.”
Reviews.Author: sbidwell
Reviews.Content: The bad things about this hotel were, the pool is not heated and it was way too expensive for just a simple room! The beds were very comfortable and the staff was very nice. Bennigan's Restaurant was right next to the hotel so that was nice and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the La Quinta Airport North”
Reviews.Author: Sandyarnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Quinta Airport North on our way to Cuba and at the La Quinta Airport East on our way back in january 2012.. It was amost like staying in 2 totally different hotels, if these are supposed to be part of a chain. The Airport North was so far from the airport we really could have stayed in Miami, while the East was far closer to the airport and that made for incredible airport noise if you wanted to sit by the pool. The North is shabby, the East far better. But the East is also pricier though more convenient to an early morning flight. I would try this chain again, but probaby skip the ones at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: Jag978
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre -cruise and found the room to be clean and beds comfortable. Breakfast was good but the seating is limited. The area at the entrance of the hotel could use some improvement. The shuttle to the port was free but crowded and an hour off schedule. You can hear the planes overhead but not a big problem. Only one restaurant within walking distance. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Check in Early to Get to Cruise Port in Timely Manner”
Reviews.Author: luvstravel2
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight pre-cruise but had a late arrival. We had planned to leave for the port by 11 am but were told we could only get on a 1 pm shuttle. As it turned out,we managed to get on the noon shuttle BUT it only arrived at 12:50 and made many stops which got us to the cruise port at roughly 2:15 pm. A number of people did not wait for this shuttle and went by cab which is why we got on the "earlier" shuttle. Don't know what time the 1 pm shuttle left. The hotel transfer scheduler did not explain or apologize about the late departure and we were almost at the point of taking a taxi ourselves. The cruise ship wanted everyone to arrive prior to 2 pm. So my advice is to get in to the hotel earlier so you can be guaranteed to arrive to the port worry free. Had no complaint with the hotel otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “good precruise stay”
Reviews.Author: missjane75
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night before boarding our cruise. No frills, but clean. Free shuttle from airport & free shuttle to cruise port the next day. Great value for the $$$$. Complimentary breakfast wasn't so great, but we knew we would be ok once on the ship!!! There is a nice restaurant/bar right next to the hotel for good food & drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Airport Hotel was great or pre-cruise night”
Reviews.Author: herbalsoaplady
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night prior to a cruise. Free shuttle from airport and they do provide transportation to the cruise port for free. We opted for a cab. The driver of the shuttle was very good and attentive. Front desk personnel were on the ball. Breakfast is your normal LaQuinta and all one needs. Rooms were quiet and bed was comfortable. There is a restaurant to walk to for dinner. Not much else. Great for pre cruise night.

Reviews.Title: “don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: mark d
Reviews.Content: the best things about this hotel were the free shuttles, and the breakfast. the room wasn't very clean, the beds were small and hard. the planes flew over often and were very loud. i wouldn't stay here again, the bad things out weighed the good

Reviews.Title: “First and last stop on our cruise.”
Reviews.Author: fusie12
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here before and after a cruise. We were picked up at the airport and checked in quickly. The shuttle runs every half hour. The room was comfortable and as quiet as can be expected this close to the airport. The bed was comfortable. The hotel provided a shuttle to the cruise docks the next morning. We chose to get our own transportation back after the cruise. They stored our bags untill the room was ready and it was ready earlier than promised. The staff is friendly and very helpful with printing off our bording passes. Check out was the easiest. Breakfast was OK but crowded with a lot of people also getting ready to cruise. We walked to Bennigan's for supper both days. I will stay here again if I return to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Hemanth K
Reviews.Content: Location convenient for Miami airport (shuttle provided), also for city touring; 15-20 mins to Miami beach, and Jungle Island; 30 mins to Everglades etc. New and nice HD Samsung TVs and free wi-fi of course. Also has a pool. Room is very clean and maintained well. Breakfast area is crammed. All-in-all, good value for the price and decent to stay with family. No pet fee is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “1 Night pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Theresa967
Reviews.Content: We had no problems with this hotel. I knew before hand that we were only taking carry on luggage on the flight and would have no rental car to go shopping. So beforehand, I mailed my "non-flyables" sun blocks, shampoos, and large liquids I could not take on a plane. The front desk had my package when I got there. So first, the shuttle. We used the courtesy phone at the airport and had maybe a 20 minute wait. Not bad! I also called at noon that day to reserve a spot on the shuttle to the port the next day as per a suggestion here on another review. Next, check in. Took about 5 minutes. The front desk girls were very friendly. If you are using a AAA discount take your card. They do ask for it. We were on the 2nd floor. Room was very clean and fresh smelling as was the bathroom. A/C had the room nice and cool and the beds were really comfy. Loved the soft comforters on them. The A/C made enough "white noise" that the airplanes were a non issue. There was a soda machine down the hall by the elevators, also an ice machine. We did not use the pool. Dinner we went across the parking lot to Bennigans. Now since the gratuities are built into your check is probably why the service is so/so. We did have a little bit of a wait. We had nowhere to be though. I can say our food was very good. I had the appetizer sampler and my daughter had a bacon cheese burger w/fries. Portions were big and it was delicious. We did get the pizza flyers under our door, looked over them and the prices were very reasonable. I think we paid about $35 at Bennigans, that was our 2 meals, sodas w/refills plus tip. Breakfast the next morning was adequate. Hey, its free! Waffles you make yourself, cold cereals, fruit, yogurts, bagels and breads, boiled eggs and instant oatmeal. Coffee/tea, milks and juices. Fine to tide you over. Check out was easy. They slipped the bill under your door in the morning and you just called the front desk if the bill is as its suppose to be.. Shuttle to the port was ontime picking us up. There was a race in downtown Miami that day which made traffic a nightmare so the shuttle was scheduled for 8:45 am. A 20 minute ride turned into an hour and a half but was no fault of the hotel or the driver. He even warned us before we left that traffic was horrible and we sat downtown in 1 spot for an hour. Only reason Im mentioning this is you might want to make sure there are no races the day you go! This hotel was a good value, was very clean, staff friendly and I would absolutely stay here pre cruise again!

Reviews.Title: “expansive, loud from airport, not worth....”
Reviews.Author: sofietravel
Reviews.Content: it was loud all night as we heared the airplanes from airport, breakfastroom really small when hotel is packed, breakfast not to bad, but everything given in plastic, they charged 118 usd, for this dark room... to much and service very low ! I dont book anymore when other chance. But internet good, bed good.. Only when I have to go early to airport, then yes maybe..

Reviews.Title: “Good value - loooong wait for airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: gotta-c-sun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Quinta Airport East in Miami for 1 night 2 weeks ago before a cruise. We were attracted by the free airport shuttle and the free shuttle to the cruise port. Overall we found this hotel offered good value. There were 10 of us (in 3 rooms, 6 adults & 4 children), so we saved quite a bit of money we would have otherwise spent on taxis or shuttles, and breakfast was also included. However, we did find that we got what we paid for with the free shuttles... When we arrived at the shuttle pick up at the airport my dad called the hotel and was told we had just missed the shuttle and the next would be along in approximately 20 minutes. We stood on the curb watching & waiting, with 4 wiggly kids and a heap of suitcases, car seats, strollers, etc. However, we waited over 45 minutes before the shuttle came back. We saw other hotel's shuttles come twice before we saw ours. And we were very disappointed when the shuttle driver passed us by, saying he was too full for us, but he'd be back soon. We waited AT LEAST another 30 minutes before he came back! Luckily we did get on that shuttle. And weren't we even more suprised to find the drive from the airport to the hotel took only 5 minutes. So we're not exactly sure why only 2 shuttles came in almost an hour and a half?! Once we got to the hotel, everything was ok. Luckily we were second in line for check in; others behind us waited a while. Everything was satisfactory in our rooms, beds & bathrooms were clean, beds comfortable. We had at least 6 different pizza delivery flyers under our door, which was slightly annoying, but not really a big deal. My husband and brother-in-law took the kids swimming, the pool was fine, but water was quite cold. We could hear planes taking off overhead, but were tired, so it didn't keep us awake and there weren't any during the night - the first one I heard in the morning was after 7am. The front desk staff were helpful. We wanted to go shopping for a few last minute things and they gave us some recomendations and helped us get a cab. Breakfast in the morning was good, there were quite a few options - cereals, waffles, toast, bagels, yogurt & fruit, hard boiled eggs, coffee, tea & juice. Breakfast was busy between 9-10 am, but most of us ate earlier and didn't find it too bad and my mom and I ate after 10 and there was still lots available and not too busy then either. We booked our shuttle to the port when we checked in and the first available time for our group was 11am. We were asked to be ready in the lobby 15 minutes early. We were, but the shuttle was about 20 minutes late, so that was quite a wait again, but we didn't have anything else to do anyway . We were still at the port with plenty of time. If we were travelling to Miami to stay more than 1 night, I wouldn't stay here. It was in an industrial area near the airport - nothing to do there, however if you want to be near the airport, this is a good choice. Pre-cruise, I would stay there again, hopefully with improvements to the shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: The Boston Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta Inn & Suites Miami Airport East the night before we were leaving on a cruise. The front desk staff, Jessica and Evy, were extremely helpful. The first room we were assigned smelled of smoke. Upon hearing that from us, we were offered a choice of different rooms and got one that had no smoke smell. American Airlines lost our suitcase and we had to go back to the airport a couple of times. The driver, Karel, was very helpful and pleasant. Evy recommended a nearby Cuban restaurant which was very good. The WiFi was free, breakfast was good, the price of the hotel was very good, the shuttle to the cruise port was free, and the hotel even had $10 vouchers that could be purchased to travel from the cruise port to the airport when the cruise ended. Really, what more can you ask for? We thought this hotel was a great value and a perfect place to stay before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “very basic”
Reviews.Author: pattiBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: excellent location if you are on a stop between 2 flights, but it is very basic. A cockroach appeared on a wall at night. the breakfast was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value hotel”
Reviews.Author: brownboy_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night - pre-cruise, and the hotel is great. Clean family friendly, free shuttle to Cruise port - NOTE: must sign up for shuttle when checking -in. Daily, free breakfest, clean rooms, close walking distance to 1 restaurant, good value per night rate, friendly helpful staff. Thank you La Quinta Inn Miami Airport East

Reviews.Title: “Great for travelers going on a cruise!”
Reviews.Author: jes58
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for cruisers. Shuttle provided from the airport and also to the Port of Miami. Free parking while traveling if you drive to Miami. Everthing about this location, including breakfast, won't disappoint the budget-minded traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Our Pre-Cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristineJimGubitosi
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at La Quinta's a few times prior so we knew what to expect. Room was clean & neat. Free transportation to the port for our cruise the next day. The only thing that I was disappointed in was the fact that they didn't have hot tea/coffee availability in the lobby as they did in the other La Quinta's. We enjoy an evening tea before bed and actually had to walk to the neighboring hotel to get some. That's the only thing that we would have to say that was disappointing. Everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise hotel with transportation”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: We chose this La Quinta due to their free transportation to the Port of Miami. It's located right near the airport but the sound of the jets wasn't that bad. It is a hotel-style, rather than the typical motel-style La Quinta. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There is a good pub/grill right next door as well. Certainly a good choice for cruisers!

Reviews.Title: “Met My Needs”
Reviews.Author: Bermychick8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night after returning from a cruise. I planned on doing a bit of shopping before returning home so I picked a cheap hotel just to sleep in for the most part. Check-in went smoothly and the staff were very pleasant however I was a bit worried when I got to the room. Don't get me wrong, for the price the room was adequate. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was ok ( clean but sort of dingy looking) and the room was quiet. The TV looked brand new and the best feature for me was the free wi fi. The only issues I had was more of a security thing. The curtains of the outside type room did not close completely and the guests in the room next door were sort of hanging out on the shared balcony area. As a single female traveller it didn't really make me feel at ease. The location was ok if you have a car. There doesn't seem like its much to do in the immediate area. I was hoping for something a bit closer to the Dolphin Mall /Miami International Mall area but that was my fault for not really doing my homework. Overall, if the decision was just to be made on price and I was only staying for one or two nights I might stay here again. But you definitely get what you pay for and if you are not high maintenance I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I've stayed in other low/mid priced hotels and wanted to check out immediately or not touch anything in the room for fear of catching a disease. You wouldn't have that problem here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from December 31, 2011 until January 2, 2012. The free airport shuttle picked us up within 5 minutes of claiming our baggage and we were at La Quinta within another 10. Check in time is 3 pm, but we were able to check in and be to our room by noon. Our room was very clean and well kept, except for the broken latch-lock on the door. Also, the beds are extremely comfortable, but this hotel is very close to MIA, so if you're a light sleeper, bring earplugs! The desk staff and housekeepers at La Quinta were extremely helpful, but the food staff for breakfast would not give you the time of day. Breakfast was okay. It consisted of waffles, hard boiled eggs, toast, bagels, yogurts, 2 kinds of cereal, and 2 kinds of juice. There was some fresh fruit, but it was typically gone by the time we went down there. On the weekends, the breakfast is open until 10, but it is only open until 9 on the weekdays. There are not enough tables to eat at, so people are spilling into the lobby. The tables they do have are round, so it is impossible to put them together if you're in a group larger than 2. The cruise shuttle is great, especially since it is free (only one way). To get back to either MIA or La Quinta after your cruise, it is only $10 per person. This is significantly cheaper than calling a cab or paying for transfers through your cruise line. Whatever you do, do not go to the restaurant outside the hotel called Bennigans. The service was ridiculously slow, the food was expensive, it wasn't that good, and they charge you a 15% service fee, plus a tip! Overall, this is a great hotel and I would definitely stay here pre-cruise again!

Reviews.Title: “Free Shuttle is Just The Beginning...”
Reviews.Author: action_jackson2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta the day before sailing on a cruise. That was the main reason why we decided to stay there. Although the service upon check-in was questionable, everything else was great. The rooms were nice and clean (as I have found with all LQs), it was moderately quiet and the breakfast was okay. I say just 'okay' because in comparison to other LQ locations the breakfast was sub-par but in comparison to other hotel chains I would say it was pretty good. Very busy, but good. The free shuttle was wonderful. Great service + free = win-win! Just remember that the free shuttle to POM is one-way only; there is a charge to be transported back to the hotel after your cruise. All in all, I would stay here again just to take advantage of the free shuttle. Too bad it's not located closer to South Beach...

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you are taking a cruise”
Reviews.Author: TravelSteveR
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this location before a cruise. It is conveniently located, provides a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel, and, most importantly, provides free transportation to the port, saving you the cost of that transportation. The rooms are fine, and the staff is very nice. I agree with other posters about the breakfast, however. It is very weak. We stayed at the La Quinta in Tillman's Corner over the Christmas holiday, and it had scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits, gravy, donuts, and danish. The Miami Airport East location has none of those--just hard boiled eggs (which I hate), cereal, bread, waffles, and packages of oatmeal. It's a shame that the breakfast offerings are not standardized throughout the chain. Also, we encountered several rude people in the very small breakfast area, including one man who refused to move from the toaster area, blocking everyone else from using it. It's not rocket science--put your bread in the toaster and step back so that others can use the other slots on the two toasters that are there. Also, guard your chairs with your life. My roommate got up to get something, and someone grabbed his chair without asking if were done with it. Also, we saw the same little girl on the sole computer in the business center every time we passed by. Based upon another post I made, readers should know that this is one of my pet peeves. It is a business center, not a day care. Unfortunately, there was no sign limiting the computer's usage time or its users' age. The fitness center had one but not the computer area. All-in-all, however, we like this property and will continue to stay there when we cruise out of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Will return to LaQuinta East again - Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: SawmillDerek
Reviews.Content: We drove to LaQuinta East by Miami Airport the day before our 11 day cruise. Nice, clean, but plain rooms, free parking for car and free buffet next morning. Great Cuban restaurant, Hitching Post, with hotel pickup and return only $5 per couple. Hotel was fine except for noise from overhead planes if that bothers one. Helpful staff, especially Marcel. Be sure not to miss the small service road when trying to locate hotel from GPS. Will definitely return there before our next cruise! Barbara

Reviews.Title: “Know Before You Go”
Reviews.Author: matty18
Reviews.Content: This hotel may not be for everyone. It really depends on what you are looking for. It is a great place to stay if you are coming in the day before your ship departs. The shuttle service from the airport and to the ship is free for guests, although you have to be willing to wait a while for the shuttle. The rooms could be a bit cleaner and the breakfast bar was very limited. The size of the outdoor pool is large, but it is not heated. There is absolutely nothing within walking distance from the hotel except a Benningan's restaurant, so you have to be willing to take a cab anywhere else. With all that said, it is a good value for under $100 and a great option to stay at before catching the boat.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Rental Car, Free Shuttle to Cruise Port and Airport”
Reviews.Author: MotorgliderPilot
Reviews.Content: In very good condition, Friendly helpful service. We arrived at MIA, rented a car and stayed the night before a cruise out of the Port of Miami. The hotel is very close to the rental car facility and walking distance to Bennigans restaurant. We turned our rental car in the next morning and without luggage we chose to walk back to the Hotel (Note there are not sidewalks or crosswalks in some places but it is only a 10 or 15 minute walk) There is a free train connecting the rental car facility to the airport and La Quinta has a free shuttle about every half hour but the time is probably shorter to walk it. We collected our luggage and got a free shuttle to the cruise terminal at the Port of MIami. On the KSA Shuttle we were told we can pay only $10 per person to get the shuttle back to the airport which is cheaper than the cost the Royal Carribean Cruise line charges.

Reviews.Title: “Spent One Night Then to Cruise Ship”
Reviews.Author: Thetravelers01
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves a ten from me! My friend and I stayed here one night prior to hopping on a cruise ship. The shuttle service that picked us up at the airport was on time and the driver was extremely courteous. Upon arriving at the hotel--the front desk was quick to process us when we arrived. We had a two double beds on the fourth floor. In the morning, the breakfast area was quite crowded and there was only cereal out with coffee and bread and bagels, yet, this was just enough to get us through the morning then we were taken by van to the port. Again, staff was polite and treated us with much care. A great hotel four needs. If you are a light sleeper, you may want ear plugs. Airplanes overhead are quite loud. Certainly, this is not the hotel's fault, just the proximity to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Cool for one night stay for cruise”
Reviews.Author: nowyouccakes
Reviews.Content: Room was okay for a one night stay prior to a cruise. Beds were fine. Carpet was dingy. Check in was easy. Breakfast was typical. Shuttle service wasn't too bad. Easy process. You could definitely hear the airplane overhead. If you buy the transportation for the ride back to the make sure keep your receipt they give you AND wear the sticker they give you. We waited for a while but if it wasn't for the sticker I don't think we would have found the driver. The color of the van was different then they said it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: dine56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here before our cruise. The room was very nice. When returning to the hotel after dinner we were involved in a car accident, the staff was very helpful in secureing our car so we could still travel the next morning as planned. We did a load of clothes in the laundry provided but when I tried to use the dryer it stopped working mid cycle, when I mentioned that we would be traveling with the wet clothes, the maintenence man took our wet clothes and dried them in the machine used for the sheets. We have another cruise planned and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “who run this place”
Reviews.Author: MeCarg N
Reviews.Content: Nice building but the real is no one goes above and beyond all staff that acts like robots very ordinary staff bed are ok but carpet stanis-poor breakfast....sucks

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay before Anniversary Cruise”
Reviews.Author: PrePre1977
Reviews.Content: The hotel is hard to find, best if there is two people in the car so one can look out for it. Check in was a breeze. We were the first ones to sign up for the shuttle for the cruise port. Our room was great. It was facing the airport but we did not hear any planes taking off or landing. Went to Bubba Gump for dinner had that already planned. Woke up early for the shuttle trip. First ones down to breakfast. Made two waffles and had some yogurt. Plenty of juice. Hubby had the same. We did move so others could sit down to enjoy their breakfast. Enjoyed the free shuttle but did not get the opportunity to take advantage of the return price for the shuttle. They didn't offer it and I would have paid for it. Got a cab from cruise port and that was the worst mistake ever! Next year I will make sure I ask about the return pick up for extra money. The shuttle was not crowded we had a few empty seats. Price was great $66.67 for one night after taxes the price was 89 when I first booked our room but it dropped in July to 59. Glad I rebooked it bc it went back up. Will I book them again for a Miami trip? Yes I would.

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay before cruise”
Reviews.Author: sdscaz
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in La Quintas from CA to Fl and this was our least favorite. The rooms were clean and the bed comfortable. The noise from the airport (felt like you were on the runway) made it hard to sleep. Breakfast was not up to La Quinta standards. No muffins or pasteries, no yogurt, no fresh fruit. The employee said they were out and it was only 7:45 am. Free shuttle to the cruise ship made it all worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ohio1956
Reviews.Content: Choose La Quinta mostly because reasonably priced and included breakfast and transfer to Port of Miami. Unfortunately it wasn't a great experience. After checking in my 20yr old daughter-in- law saw a very large bug and couldn't forget she saw it. So I sent my son down to see what they could do. Staff was very helpful but said nothing could be done but checked with manager maybe who was just coming in and he arranged for another room. Very thankful. Breakfast was OK but things got much worse with the free shuttle to port. I believe transport name on bus was SKA. He packed us in bus like sardine with no air conditioning or open window in 90 degree plus full sun for 15 min while he loaded the suitcases. When he got in he said he had 3 rules, your'e on vacation, no complaining , and he drives fast. 20 hot min later I had 3 rules for him. He drives like a maniac, the ride was torturous and hot, and I am on vacation and a fourth, no tip for you thank you. The hotel needs to hire another co. That was terrible

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good but.....”
Reviews.Author: ocwarren
Reviews.Content: For easy exits to the airport this is your hotel. This La Quinta literally sits next to the airport. I can see planes. Never stayed at a La Quints before at least that I can remember. This one once you get inside was fairly nice. The room appeared to be cozy and the bed comfortable. The view only a parking lot but I guess better than facing the airport. The breakfast was typical continental style breakfast but complimentary so no need to complain. The but that I was referring to in my title was...... I caught a small live cockroach crawling across my bathroom floor which I quickly squashed and flushed. All the other bathroom amenities were on par. All I can say is that it was a nice stay and for many reasons I would consider staying again, but just on the slight notion that I will find more creepy crawly disease ridden bugs I will do my best to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a Night at the Airport - A Parking Tip Follows”
Reviews.Author: chris32137
Reviews.Content: Note: see near the end for a tip that will save you money. We stayed at this hotel on our way out of town. It was basic, but fine for a night. The rooms were tired, the linens were tired, the place was a little dirty, the breakfast was abysmal, but the location was perfect and it was OK, but not great value. Everything above should be self expanatory, but the breakfast deserves comment. One worker was trying to deal with a flood of people, families, kids, etc. Coffee was out, there was a line for the microwave, bagels were removed, etc. etc. You get the picture. The prize wasn't worth the cracker jacks... It was at best "amateur hour" and management clearly wasn't at home. What made it almost OK was (and here is the tip) that La Quinta has a policy in several of its airport inns, to give you free parking for up to a week if you stay there the night before you leave. This is great because you can come in the night before, extend your vacation a day, and leave your car, virtually for free. Everybody wins. So, this hotel was "OK at best", but remember this tip when you fly. Check out La Quinta for free parking. You may get a nice bonus on your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edgaroliveira
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, my room was very clean, the staff was great. My only complaint is that i got a smoking room. The rest was ok! Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good for short-stay”
Reviews.Author: Dequanna
Reviews.Content: Friendly service and genuinely nice staff. Adequate continental breakfast included in the room. Easy, comfortable atmosphere and free airport shuttle is a definite plus. I don't like the fact that the sink is outside the bathroom area and over a carpeted area. This means that the carpet is often damp from splashes and it contributes to a faint but persistent odor. I suggest that the area around the sink should be tiled. I believe the overwhelming fragrance one of the reviewers referred to was to mask this carpet odor. Otherwise, not bad value for price and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for price.”
Reviews.Author: jes58
Reviews.Content: Convenient location for cruisers. Staff very friendly and helpful. Free shuttle to the port. Very reasonable rates. Was a little wary because of the rates but was pleasantly surprised. Car can be parked there for a week, also free. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Migraine inducing fragrance everywhere”
Reviews.Author: tinlizzy2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 4 times pre-cruise because flights from the Midwest usually arrive late. They have breakfast and a free shuttle. Unfortunately someone decided to put air fresheners in all the air conditioning units, including the shuttle's rear air conditioner. I had a migraine within an hour and they offered me another room when I questioned them - denying there was any fragrance. Same smell different room. Again they lied about using a fragrance. By morning I had what sounded like an asthmatic cough and splitting headache - they gave me 20% off the room. It was the shuttle driver who finally came clean and admitted they were pumping in fragrance throughout the hotel and shuttle. The worst part was that 2 outfits, night clothes, and my suitcase all reeked of whatever they were using and the horrible smell followed my to the nice clean ship. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “It was good”
Reviews.Author: b0bdole
Reviews.Content: I really enojy the hotels accomodations they let us park our car for a week there for free as long as we paid for one nights stay!! Great deal they had a pretty good breakfast too, which was also included into the package. This is a great hotel for travelers and cruise-goers!!!!! plus it is right next to the airport for frequent flyers too and you couldn't even hear the noise of the airport considering how close you are. My daughter enjoyed watching the planes come in literally right over your head.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room and location”
Reviews.Author: Colon197
Reviews.Content: Unless you want to sleep directly below where airplanes pass through, want to end up with a smelly room of a smoker and want to walk a 500 yards to get breakfast in the morning or anything else. Do not stay here. This La Quinta is oddly designed. There are sections that separate from the main part of the Hotel and it is quite a walk from the main part of the Hotel. Breakfast closes at 9am, there are not fridges or microwaves in the rooms as i expected. I was just not very impressed with this place at all. Not a very family friendly place and the pool closes early. People are friendly, i guess that is the only positive thing i have to say about this place and its proximity to the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need when you're waiting your connection flight”
Reviews.Author: lehpares
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Quinta just for one night because my connecting flight was scheduled for 7 am next day. I red some of the TripAdvisor comments and decided to book this hotel. Is fairly good. Small, no amenities, comfortable beds, free WiFi, quite rooms and close to the airport. Daniel, the frontdesk person that night was really nice and helpful, he likes to help you and go beyond his duties. Good things: shuttle from/to airport, close to the airport, quiet rooms. The flaw: the breakfast opens at 6 am, since my flight was at 7 am, I couldn't had breakfast at the hotel. Resuming: good hotel when in a budget and thinking to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Gerry049
Reviews.Content: I picked this place because it had good reviews and was close to the airport with a free shuttle. As I had an appt late that afternoon, I came in late. Front desk staff were friendly and check-in was quick. I got to my room rather late. I noticed that, like many Miami hotels, they had a problem of people coming in and shoving pizza delivery advertising sheets under the doors. Not only were many under the door but all over the hallway. I got into my room. TV was old CRT that was slow to warm up. Wash basin had encrusted particles on it. Went to bathroom. Skid marks in the bowl. I would have taken photos had I brought my camera. I phoned reception and I was promised to have my call returned within 20 min (rush of customers). I waited an hour and then called back (it was 11pm). Receptionist apologised and said she had a rush of customers and was about to call me back. I further explained the problem and my reluctance to use the toilet (if they did not brush the bowl, think about what else was missed. She apologised and offered me 20% off the bill - she said that she would leave a note for their contracted out housekeeping. No new room or honoring La Quinta's guarantee of a free night stay if unsatisfactory. due to the late hour and no new room, I had to clean the toilet seat before I used it myself.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL FOR CRUISE GUESTS & OTHERS”
Reviews.Author: MRSVICTORY
Reviews.Content: This was a quaint little hotel off the beaten path but I enjoyed it. If you are looking for sparkles and glam then head towards the port but if you want a substaintial hotel for a good price, VERY friendly staff, clean and free parking, then this is it. We chose this hotel b/c of our 7 day Carnical Cruise. If you're not aware; if you choose to park your car at the Port near where the cruise leaves, its about $20 per day. But if you stay one night here you can leave your car for up to 7 days for FREE! On top of that they have a shuttle that takes you to the Port! You cant loose. The shuttle was early, & got us there in more than enough time. They also have a service via the hotel that will arrage for you to be picked up but we decided on a taxi back from the port. It seemed quicker for about the same amount. Checking into the hotel was quick and easy. We were given a nice room with 2 queen beds. Very clean, standard bathroom. Internet was a little slow but Im not tripping about it. All in all this was a nice hotel that I would return to especially if Im taking a cruise. The room was only about $80 and there was also a free breakfast buffet. Kudos to all staff members!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, moldy air system”
Reviews.Author: zanothree
Reviews.Content: This hotel was convenient as it had free shuttle service from the airport. We were headed on a cruise and they also provide free (one-way) shuttle service to the port. This saved us quite a bit of money. However, I experienced very fairly severe headaches while I was there, and now believe that it was the air conditioning system that caused this. When we got on the cruise boat all of my symptoms went away - so I believe the hotel system was the cause. If you are sensitive to mold issues I would not recommend this hotel - otherwise, it was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was also very nice and well-served.

Reviews.Title: “Next time we'll pass...”
Reviews.Author: micheleb011
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived and contacted La Quinta to pick us up at the airport, it was a disppointment. The shuttle they provide that runs every 30 minutes took longer than promised. In fact, some of our party caught the neighboring hotel's shuttle to come back after they waited over an hour. The pool was dirty and filled with salt water which we weren't expecting. Hard to enjoy the pool atmosphere with the airplanes from nearby Miami Airport. The rooms were not ready even though we arrived 2+ hours after check-in time. There is 1 restaurant within walking distance, and that was it! Nothing else in Miami is nearby. Hotel staff was mostly pleasant, but there was one gentleman that we dealt with (manager?) that was abrupt and pushy that we did not like dealing with when we purchased our ride from the Port of Miami to the airport at the end of our cruise. Word of advice--hold onto your receipts. On the bright side, breakfast provided was great; had a wide variety and was kept well-stocked. Rooms were clean. Guests in hotel were fun to be around as most of the guests seemed like they were excited and prepared to go on a cruise like we were.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for precruise stay”
Reviews.Author: ilanastone
Reviews.Content: We stayed there recently precruise. Unfortunately we had a very long wait for the shuttle to collect us from the airport. We didn't have a cell phone and had to ask someone to use theirs and it wasn't clear how to call them from the airport, we saw no telephones. We had an hour wait before the shuttle collected us, which was very distressing and tiring after our flight. The room was comfortable but the motel isn't really close to anywhere for evening meals so we had to snack there. The breakfast was good value although it was very inconvenient try to find sufficient seating. Most people were staying there precruise and there were not enough tables and chairs to cater for the amount of people waiting to eat. We took a cab to the nearest drug store to do our last minute purchasers for the cruise, there were no convenient stores close by. The free shuttle to the port was convenient and organised. I'm not sure if I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine after we found it”
Reviews.Author: JoeyHWV
Reviews.Content: Had a terrible time finding the hotel due to really crappy directions from our car's GPS, that seems to be a trend on this vacation. We stayed overnight here before our family cruise. The hotel is older and not as fancy as hotels we usually like to stay in but for under $75 including free parking during our cruise, free breakfast and free shuttle that's not a bad deal. The hotel looks clean, I always check the bathroom to really judge a hotel and ours looked good, no mold or anything else icky. If you want the Ritz I wouldn't stay here if you want a clean place to lay your head down before you catch a plane or a ship then this place is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Needed two nights in Miami before flying overseas”
Reviews.Author: MichaelJC
Reviews.Content: This was a decent option near the airport that allowed me to have my meetings and be close to some big box stores I needed to shop at before departure. Planes do fly over but the noise stops over night. The hotel was truly average in most regards, with service being a bit below and cleanliness abit above standard hotels. The problem with the customer service was not attitude, but seemed to come from lack of staffing which kept the front desk staff backed up regularly. If you need a night or two...there are worse options.

Reviews.Title: “Free van transport to cruise dock!”
Reviews.Author: Fairbanksfour
Reviews.Content: Nicest desk staff you will ever meet! FREE van transport for you and all that luggage to Port of Miami for your cruise! Free breakfast! All for under $80.00 night. Rooms and swimming pool very clean. Not the Ritz, but I will definitely stay there when I am cruising out of Miami! A rare find!

Reviews.Title: “Decent for Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: VeeRated
Reviews.Content: I have super high expectations for cleanliness at hotels. I did tons of research making sure which hotels have had reports of bed bugs and this one was the best deal in a decent location and the best part was: they have a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel and from the hotel to the port of miami. Unfortunately, I called for a shuttle and the phone just rang constantly and no one EVER picked up. Luckily my friend had a different flight and had taken a different shuttle from Ft. Lauderdale and was at the hotel when I called so she had me talk to the lady at the front desk on her cellphone. (Who was amazingly nice by the way). When the shuttle got to the airport the driver was on the complete opposite side from where all the passengers were standing and even though I was waving him down he did not stop and drove past me causing me to have to wait 45 minutes for a return trip. Not cool. Finally I got to the hotel and check-in didnt take too long even though I was last in line. Be sure to book your port shuttle when you check in! Its really important because the next morning is complete chaos. The hotel itself was clean enough. Nothing spectacular. Just do yourself a favor and dont look at the mattressess under the sheets or you'll gross yourself out. :) The sheets themselves were clean though luckily. (Being the germaphobe I am, I always bring my own sheets) I did my bed bug check (using a blow dryer, check the internet for directions, lol) it came out clean and we got settled in. Our remote didnt work but they replaced it immediately. Other then that, the room was pretty good. Black out curtains were perfect. There's literally nothing around the hotel except the highway and a Bennigans which is awesome because all the ones I know of had closed down so we went there for dinner. They recommend not eating at the places that put fliers under your door. And trust me, you will get some. We got about 8 of them. Just eat at Bennigans and call it a night. As for the continental breakfast.. It was crowded but the lines moved quickly. Nearly everyone there we later learned, was there for a cruise. They had cereal, fruit, a waffle maker!!, bagels, bread, etc. Pretty standard. It would've been awesome if they had lactose free milk but I guess you cant win em all. :) We checked in and signed up for the 12 o'clock port shuttle and we were the first on the list for that time. It was so very unorganized and chaotic that they never called our names out and we missed the shuttle leaving us to wait an hour I think for the next one. I was pretty angry seeing as how I had talked to the guy about the shuttle less than 10 minutes prior to finding out we missed it. He was super apologetic though at least. Overall, just be patient with the shuttles and you'll be fine. If youre looking for some night life, stay in SoBe. This place is great to stay for pre-cruise and despite the shuttle mishaps I'll def stay here the next time I cruise out of Miami. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: celticgypsy
Reviews.Content: Stayed there two separate nights and was pleased at the value and liked the location if you're needing to be near the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: kmaz100
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night on return from Honduras. Really strong hot showers and comfortable beds!!! Although it is beside the airport, the double glazing works really well and we all slept soundly. The breakfast was great but there was not a lot of sitting room as it was very popular, but we only had to wait a few minutes for a table. Delicious waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you are taking a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Going4now
Reviews.Content: They pick you up at the airport and take you to the hotel and the next day they will take you to your ship. Be sure to sign up for the transportation for the cruise drop off as soon as you check in, otherwise you will be fighting the crowds the next day. The breakfast is good, the rooms clean...good price.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle to cruise great bonus!”
Reviews.Author: KAD56
Reviews.Content: check in was quick, we had 3 rooms for family on 3rd floor, breakfast was very nice , but with it being Vacation wk we had a hard time finding chairs for everyone to eat, we had to take turns/shifts to eat, waffles & eggs good. We returned a rental car in the morning , but had a hard time finding LaQuinta shuttle to get back ,So ck directions @ front desk. We received our shuttle time of 11 for Norweign cruise & bus came as scheduleed, Lg window that we sat next to was badly broken , hope they fix before someone gets cut, I had to change seats with my nephew(age 8) because he would have poked at it! Driver polite & ride was about 15 min to cruiseport, we tipped him for freee ride, I would stay again before or after cruise !

Reviews.Title: “OK for pre-cruise overnight”
Reviews.Author: RainbowWrasse
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here both the night before and the night following our cruise. The pre-cruise stay was fine. I arrived much later than expected due to a delay in my flight, and mom arrived first. Evy at the front desk was very helpful and allowed mom to check in without me (I had the credit card). They gave us a standard double rather than the superior king I had pre-booked, but said nothing about the change, so I had to take initiative to speak to the front desk the next morning and they adjusted the rate. Breakfast is quite substantial, and the transportation to the port (the primary reason we booked) is well-handled. On the basis of just this night, I would have rated the hotel higher. We took the advice of previous reviewers and took a cab from the port to the hotel following disembarkation, so I can't speak to the efficiency of the post-cruise transportation for which there is a fee. We arrived at the hotel mid-morning, and by noon they were able to check us in, which was nice. There were 3 things that soured me on this hotel: (1) In this room the carpet was filthy, as the bottoms of my feet (and socks after I realized how dirty the carpet was and put them on) picked up the dirt; (2) The toilet paper roll had not been replaced and quickly ran out, nor was a spare roll available. When I called the front desk, they said I had to come down and get one (???!!!); (3) After checking out and returning home, later that day I developed itchy bites on my toes, the last vestiges of which are still there 1-1/2 weeks later. I don't think they were mosquito bites. We had to leave much too early for breakfast, so the overall value of that final night for the price was just not there. With regard to customer service, one of my pet peeves is being asked for a high rating on a survey. This hotel has permanent signs in several places saying that they strive to provide the highest service and if a post-stay survey is received to please rate them a 10. I don't know about you, but making a guest come down to the front desk for a roll of toilet paper doesn't strike me as a high level of service! Regarding dining, again at the recommendation of previous reviewers, we walked over to the Embassy Suites for an early dinner rather than to Bennigan's. (I don't think I'd do this in the dark.) Although the service was very good and the food was tasty (albeit swimming in butter), the prices were outrageously high. Portions are huge, so unless you are very hungry, I'd recommend splitting a salad and an entree between two people. Note: We tried calling the Cuban/American place to pick us up as suggested by one person, but they were short-staffed and could not provide transportation. All in all this hotel is a decent value for a pre-cruise overnight stay including breakfast and port transfers.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: mrxcitement
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the La Quinta Miami Airport East after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. What we needed was a reasonable hotel that offered free transportation to the airport, so I could return our rental car, and to the Port of Miami for the start of our cruise. This place did both. For the airport, all I had to do was return the car, take the rental car shuttle bus to the airport, and then catch the La Quinta bus back to the hotel. For the port shuttle, you MUST tell them when you check in that you need a shuttle to the port. They're familiar with all the regular cruise schedules and will get you to the port in plenty of time. As far as the hotel, the public areas and rooms were well maintained and comfortable. They include a free breakfast too, so that was a real money saver. The hotel is not in a particulary attractive area and is pretty much wedged in between a number of highway ramps and access roads, but that's what you get at airport hotels. The pool area was fine but the noise from the jets overhead kept me away from that area. You CAN hear jet noise in your hotel room but it's well insulated enough that the noise level is acceptable. All in all, this was a good value. Our stay was comfortable and hassle free, and the shuttle service worked well for us. Oh, and there's a Bennigans within 2 minutes walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: orito63
Reviews.Content: We booked a night at this hotel through Expedia. When we arrived with our confirmation code, after flying for 24 hours without sleep, they had no record of our reservation and no rooms available. Don't know if it was their fault or Expedias, but the staff was nice and the price and location by the airport were good, so we gave them another chance on our return from Ecuador. On the 2nd round we booked through the hotel and actually got a room, but we found dried urine all over the toilet seat and the sink was full of hair and dried toothpaste.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a pre-cruise stay.”
Reviews.Author: mkirch72
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel because of it's pre-cruise related amenities, and it did not disappoint. Included in the hotel rate is a free airport shuttle, free continental breakfast (including fresh waffles, cereals, fruit, yogurt, toast, bagels, muffins, fresh fruit, coffee, juice, etc.), and most importantly: free shuttle from the hotel to the cruise ship AND the ability to leave your car parked on the hotel property for FREE for up to a week if you stayed at the hotel. This deal absolutely could not be beat. Regarding the hotel itself: PROS: --Comfortable, updated, super clean, spacious rooms (see cons also). --Outdoor swimming pool (nice to unwind pre-cruise after long flight/drive). --Friendly, patient, accomodating staff (see cons below). --Good selection for continental breakfast and staff member quickly cleaning all tables and replenishing food selection. ---Free shuttle to cruise ship was fairly well organized and very punctual. CONS: --Room had that distinct "this is NOT a non-smoking room" smell. But this was my fault as I had not specified in the booking and the hotel was sold-out. --Front desk was completely under-staffed during check-in. One employee was responsible for checking in a line about 10-20 people long, directing housekeeping staff via walkie-talkie, accepting deliveries from vendors, answering the switchboard phone, answering questions from current guests walking up to the counter, and booking day tours. As ridiculous as this sounds (hotel management, please give this girl a break), the employee performing these tasks (Ana I believe) could not have been more pleasant, professional, courteous and accomodating. She worked as quickly as she could and everyone in line could see that it was beyond her control, so luckily there were no tempers flaring. --The hotel allows local "restaurants" (I say this sarcastically) to deliver menus under the room doors in the evenings. These menus (many of which look suspiciously similar to one another), tout the fact that they deliver. We assumed this was with the hotel's blessing as six to ten of these so-called menus were slid under our doors over the course of an hour or two. So we ordered a pizza. This 'large' pizza was about the size of a small dinner plate and we were charged a ridiculous amount of money for it (approximately $20 including tip). The flavor was non-existant and the crust was barely cooked. I spoke to another guest who said they called the front desk and asked about these menus before ordering (lesson learned for me) and they were told the hotel does not recommend ordering from these establishments. This is something the guests should know. The hotel should either 1.) prevent unauthorized distribution of these menus or 2.) notify guests at check-in that they do not recommend ordering from them. At the very least this should be noted in the hotel information binder in the rooms. ---Dinner options are limited. There is a Bennigan's right next door. However, the Bennigan's chain has closed. This is apparently one of only two left open in the country as they were owned by a franchisee. Unfortunately, it shows. The wait staff could not speak English (I am bilingual and could not get my point across in English or Spanish), the cleanliness was NOT acceptable, and the food was a cheap imitation of what I remember as Bennigan's food (which doesn't say much). Unfortunately, if you don't have a car, there isn't much other choice. If I had to do it all over again, I'd order from Pizza Hut, Domino's, or Papa John's online. At least you know what you're getting. ---Location is literally on the perimeter of the airport. When using the pool, you will be able to waive to the people's faces you can see on the plane as they are so close. As a result, holding a conversation is next to impossible. And they take off about once every other minute. This fact doesn't bother me personally, but it may bother some. However -- the rooms are pretty well sound-proofed and I could barely hear them at night. Overall, the pros of this hotel far outweighed the cons. Every place has some areas they can improve upon. However, the relatively low price, comfortable, updated rooms, and cruise-related bonuses that are included in the rate make it definitely worthwhile. We will definitely be staying here any time we cruise out of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: ten78cop
Reviews.Content: We always pick this hotel for pre and post cruise lodging. Rooms are nice, clean, and the service is typically good. Convenience of shuttle service is a plus. Only down side is Airport pick up service is spotty. On this visit we waited an hour and 45 minutes to be picked up from the airport by the bus. Front desk kept claiming "He's out there..." Hotel is 5 minutes from pick up point to lobby. Port service is still free but now is serviced by an outside carrier who makes several stops at other hotels. He will sell you a return ride back for $20 but time window was only 1 hour. He claimed cab was $40 back. We only paid $30 for a cab including tip. If you're looking for peace and quiet you will not find it here. This property is directly on the main MIA runway. Planes start at 5am and go non-stop until around midnight. There are also whistle blowing trains in the area. This property is pretty much isolated. There is a crappy Bennigans restaurant next door but other than that and the Embassy Suites next door there is nothing. I suggest you do not wander far from this property. There are plenty of delivery fliers dropped off at the hotel. Morning breakfast is okay as far as freebies go. Hotel arranged a Miami City tour for us on our post cruise day. $60pp, 4hrs long and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stay before and after your cruise”
Reviews.Author: DuffyMax
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the day before and after our cruise. Mainly because they offer a free ride to the port. However when returning to the hotel we had to pay $20 bucks for 2 people. Not that bad. As far as the hotel staff, they were very helpful and friendly!! The rooms where in okay condition. Some new carpet and TVs would do them more justice. However, the rooms where clean and the beds were comfortable. For the price and the short stay it was worth the money. The breakfast was just so-so. It's your typical hotel continental breakfast (etc. muffins, bagels, cereal). There is a Bennigan's in walking distance of the hotel, but the service and the food is not good. If your hungry just order pizza or something from the fliers that are pushed under the door. Also, since this hotel is close to the airport; (which is convenient); it is at times noisy because of the planes. So if your like me and NOT a sound sleeper bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbsmes
Reviews.Content: For the purpose of our trip this hotel worked great. There were about 30 of us that were taking a cruise the next morning. All flew in at different times and all made it to the hotel without a hitch. Their airport pick up was great. Rooms were nice, morning breakfast was great. The reason we booked this hotel was because they offer transfers to the ship the next morning. This is provided by the hotel free of charge, but it is not the kind of tranfers where you pick the time. Basically they have 2 buses. 1 that left at 10:00 to certain ships (that was ours) and then a bus at 11:30 that left to other ships. You did not have a choice. But it worked out fine. We did get to the ship a bit early but we all just waited and we were some of the ones that got on the ship first. The only drawback of this hotel is that you are in the middle of no where. There is not a thing around you except the Embassy Suites and Bennigans. Which is where we all ate, twice that day because there was no place else if you did not have a car. But the food was good so we were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tecleski
Reviews.Content: I had to do a short stopover in Miami, and I was looking for a cheap hotel close to the airport, and, having read some Tripadvisor reviews, I chose La Quinta Inn East. Well, I don't regret having picked it up. The staff is very friendly, the room itself was big and everything in it worked fine. It's not the cleanest room I've been in, the carpet is stained, but overall, I have no complaints, for the hotel was not sold to me as more than it actually is. I wouldn't recommend the hotel to anyone having a very light sleep, for although the windows have double glass, you still can hear the airplanes landing and taking off at all times, but I sleep like a log, so it wasn't a problem for me. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Flydawg1
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, friendly and professional, but the hotel was understaffed. The noise from the planes and the train directly behind the hotel was very loud not to mention that you could hear everything that was going on in the room next door.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good for access to Miami but not a nice neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: SailingKairos
Reviews.Content: Chose this La Quinta for it's relatively inexpensive price tag and yet relatively easy access to the city. Moderately clean, breakfast provided. Pet friendly. However the hotel is located behind an abandoned restaurant and backs up to airport parking lots. Unlike other hotels in the area this one doesn't have a gate with an attendant for the parking lot - they do have cameras. We didn't sleep well worrying about a car full of camping gear.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, good value”
Reviews.Author: travellerDhan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the La Quinta Inn and Suites on Feb.19 & 20th with my wife. The hotel is very clean, staff is friendly & professional. Rooms are comfortable and washrooms are decent. Its next to the airport so it can be noisy. I paid $135 a nite and highly recommed the stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: NC-BIKER
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about this Inn, we were anxious to try it for one night prior to a cruise. We were very pleased with the stay and would not hesitate to stay again prior to another cruise. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was a REAL bonus to get the free parking while we were on the cruise as well as the free shuttle to the cruise port. It's very close to Miami International Airport, which worked out well for us when picking up another couple who were cruising with us. As stated in other reviews, because of the close proximity to the airport it was a bit noisy but that's what ear plugs are for.... definitely not a detriment to staying there for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: CarnivalCruiser43
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the La Quinta Inn and Suites on Feb. 7th for a overnight stay before a cruise. The hotel was very nice and the staff was friendly and courteous and professional. I found the rooms to be very comfortable and even though the hotel was next to the airport I was not disturbed the least by the airplanes flying over. They offered a free shuttle to the Port of Miami that the young lady at the front desk signed me right up for right after I checked in. The only problem I had with the hotel was that it is that there is very little around the area and you have to have a car or take a taxi to get somewhere. But what really impressed me with this hotel was the response that I received after I did a online survey giving my overall experience and recommendations: 'First and foremost please accept my sincere apologies for the inconvenience you received during your stay, and for not receiving the proper services you surely deserve. I want to thank you for your suggestions on the breakfast items and I would like to apologize for the lack of variety with the fruits. I will be sure to look into that issue myself. I would also like to thank you for giving me your perspective on our shuttle service. You make very valid points and I will make sure to make some improvements in that area. At this time I would like to offer you 10% off your room rate as a token of my appreciation. I have refunded the MasterCard ending in .....in the amount of $ 12.11. You should see a credit to your account within 2-3 business days. I know this does not justify any discomforts you may have experienced, but I do hope you can accept this as a good faith gesture in our part. If you are in the area again I do hope you can stay with us and give us a second chance to make things right. Again, my apologies, and thank you for letting me know of our shortcomings so I may rectify the issues." It wasn't that my hotel stay was horrible and the few complaints I had were about simple things but the fact that they took my survey and my comments to such an extent that they refunded 10% off my room rate back to me really impressed me to an extent that I would stay at this hotel again if I am ever back in Miami for a cruise. It was great customer service. Oh, and by the way, Bennagin"s(sp?) is right next door. Avoid at all costs! The food sucked and the service was even worse.

Reviews.Title: “How to make travel cost effective!”
Reviews.Author: LJB049
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling from Port of Miami, on any of the cruise lines, this maybe the place for you. They supply a shuttle to and from airport, no charge, and to the port, again no charge, savings $25. If you are driving you may leave your car for 7 days, free, savings $70 to $140. Room rates are on par with comperable hotels about $100, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is very helpful. Breakfast and a pool are both a bonus, good, clean, and free. I'm not saying to stay for a week, but for one or two nights it's a great value. Only downside is it is near airport, so you do get jet noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Queenkt08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel before and after we cruised. The staff was friendly, professional and accommodating. Things that I liked about the hotel included: Free shuttle to and from the airport, free shuttle to the port of call and the continental breakfast. After our cruise we went back to stay another night (take advantage of the $10.00 per person shuttle pick up as a taxi ride will be a little more expensive.) The hotel need to be updated, but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. We arrived back to the hotel hours before check in; the staff was kind enough to let us leave our bags in a storage like room. The only thing I didnâ€™t like was nothing in walking distance (thereâ€™s only one restaurant close to the hotel). This is good place to stay if cruising.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cfgrb
Reviews.Content: Two day precruise stay. The Staff was warm and friendly, very helpful. The cruise transfer was seamless very well done. For dining I would recommend the Embassy Suites next door or the Hitching Post BARBQ about three minutes away by car, if you call them they will pick you up and bring you back at NO CHARGE and generous servings great food and reasonably priced American, Mexican and Cuban items on a vast menu 305 877 6012 begin_of_the_skype_highlightingÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 305 877 6012Â Â Â Â Â Â end_of_the_skype_highlighting. The continental breakfast at the hotel is more than adequate. I would avoid Bennigans next door the service is slooooooooow and cleanliness is a major issue there were three other couples at 1:00 P.M. and it took two hours for sandwiches to be served, table tops and floor were sticky.
