Reviews.Title: “Great place to watch planes”
Reviews.Author: hollyarran
Reviews.Content: Friendly welcome when we arrived, its location not far from the rental car centre was good. Some noise from Train Horns and low flying aircraft. Room clean and well appointed, breakfast better than at our second hotel. Only problems were a broken U lock on the door and when i flushed the loo in the morning it kept on filling ending up with a flooded floor. I managed a temporary fix and told Reception who advised that maintenance would have a look when the came at 9. Full marks, when we returned to the room after breakfast, it had been fixed and the floor cleaned and dried. Would i stay here again, yes definately and with an excellent american irish restaurant next door maybe for longer this time

Reviews.Title: “a good value for your money,clean ,nice front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: indica007
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 1 night after a cruis.the rooms were clean with a coffee maker which we really appreciated.an additional cream and sugar was provided later at night at our request at the front desk.we could hardly hear any airplane noise in the room,concedering the proximity to the airport.ok complementary breakfast.breakfast area crowded and small.nice pool area if you don't mind the loud airplane noise.polite front desk staff.make reservations ahead of time as it's extremely busy.an exellent restaurant 1 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel...worked ok for one night”
Reviews.Author: LOVEROFPV
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on January 8th, pre-cruise. We booked this hotel for a couple reasons, free airport shuttle and free shuttle service to the pier. However, we waited for over an hour for the airport shuttle to pick us up and the pier shuttle was full so only 5 of the 8 of us could get on the shuttle, so 3 of us had to pay $37.00 for a taxi. The hotel provides continental breakfast, but good luck trying to get to any food, at 7:30am it was already packed! My husband had his waffles taken away from him as they came out of the toaster by another hotel guest. The pool area is not enjoyable as the planes are flying directly above the hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone! It was not the way I wanted to start out our vacation and I'm sorry I didn't listen to other travelers that told me to stay clear of this hotel. And, the location is not very desirable to say the least!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs!”
Reviews.Author: sneepy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on January 4th for one night before our very early Air France flight to Guadeloupe the next morning.We left our car there for 12 nights-it was free for 7 days-$5.00 a dayafter that-a GREAT deal!(security cameras all over the parking lot!). The FREE van took us to the airport-it leaves every 15 minutes starting at 5 A.M. Our room was perfect-two big beds, spacious, clean. (no fridge/micro). We paid $7800 a night with AARP rates. The hotel is a bit hard to find for non-Miami drivers, but we are Miamians. The noisy planes overhead probably would bother some people, but we love the sound of the magic jets! We also stayed after our trip for one night on January 16th(we flew in at night). The wonderful FREE van from La Quinta cruises arund the airport looking for their clients-just wave at them when you see one. On arrival at the hotel, we rushed to make sure our car was ok-It was! Our room was on the first floor this time, near the newspaper machine and the vending achines. Again, no complaints. The breakfast was pretty comon for a chain hotel-all fattening junk, no REAL butter, NO FRUIT(just apples), so avoid if you are the healthy type.(we just took the hard-boiled eggs back to our room. But the other hotel clients seemed very happy with the breakfast! The room was packed with Asians who loved the waffle machine and the waffles! We will always stay here from now on, because of the FREE shuttle/safe and reasonable parking/efficient staff, clean rooms. We LOVE La Quinta!

Reviews.Title: “Barely Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: RoswellDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (thankfully, for only) one night before a cruise. A newspaper writer might describe this property as "hardscrabble." The boarded-up, abandoned restaurant next door doesn't help the general appearance. Neither our room nor the public areas seemed particularly clean. The free wifi was extremely slow. The TV was old and small. We skipped the free breakfast, which didn't look especially appetizing. There's too many hotels close to MIA airport to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lizards and ants in the hotel room, all you need to know”
Reviews.Author: Chicagohoosier07
Reviews.Content: This is not a joke. We took a picture of a Gecko and ants in the hotel room. Neither should be welcome in a hotel room. The hotel is convenient for the airport and reasonably priced, but cleanliness is a MAJOR issue

Reviews.Title: “Good for Free Shuttle and Free Cruise Parking”
Reviews.Author: amygt1104
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because we were going on a cruise and wanted the free parking and free shuttle to Port. So for the price I paid those two things made it worth it. But, other than that I was not impressed with hotel room. I am not picky but when you pay good money for something you want to get normal amenities that work. First......internet did not work in room. Had to go to elevator or lobby to connect. 2nd.......t.v. remote would not work and actually fell apart in my hand then when I got up to turn down volume the buttons on the tv didn't work either. Very annoying. I did call about remote they said I could come down and get some batteries. But, I don't think that was the problem. The breakfast is your normal continental. So, it satisfied the hunger of morning. The planes are loud but you are right at the airport so expect that noise. The hotel staff is very organized and the shuttle to port was done very smoothly and that helped us make our nice transition to the rest of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel very near to airport. Basic but everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: Allyjet
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in this hotel. Rooms were perfect, clean, free wireless internet in your room, bath and coffee machine. It is around the corner from the hotel with excellent shuttle services. Breakfast is well organised and good. Location is convenient because of the proximity to the airport but otherwise the location is quite remote. We recommend renting a car to get you to Miami Beach, Fort Lauderdale etc because without a car it will be difficult to get around. We did not sleep to well because of jetlag but also because of the airtraffic and the noisyness of the hotel. Keep that in mind. There were no airplanes after midnight though, Staff is very friendly but also very busy.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for cruising and driving to miami”
Reviews.Author: brnsofia
Reviews.Content: we love the location the shuttle to the pier and the hotel itself. very pleasant staff. we drove to miami for cruise and got to leave the car for free for 7 days. pier costs $20 a day and for the same price we got a hotel for a night, free parking, transportation to pier and breakfast. cab back to hotel with tip was 30$. easy to get on i-95. only downside was the breakfast. not so great but it was some food for the belly

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, clean, safe, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: RuthCM
Reviews.Content: After traveling on an airport shuttle through several neighborhoods on my way to the hotel from the Ft. Lauderdale airport, I was thrilled when we drove up to the hotel. It was in a nice safe area, very clean, and in a convenient location. It is right by the Miami airport. Check in was easy and we were impressed with the large size of our room. Even though we were right next to the airport the noise from the planes was so muffled we hardly heard them. The breakfast in the morning had a lot of selections including making your own waffles. We chose this hotel because of its free shuttle to the Port of Miami and we were very pleased with the shuttle service. The bus was clean and the trip was very short. According to the taxi rates it would have been about $25 for us to take a taxi from our hotel to the cruise port so that was a nice savings. You just have to make sure you sign up for the shuttle when you check in. The hotel also offers free in room Wi-Fi and it worked perfectly for us. I would definitely stay here again if we ever go back to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates and clean”
Reviews.Author: jks336
Reviews.Content: We had 6 ppl in our group. Hotel offers shuttle to the port of Miami which is a plus! Hotel was clean and the breakfast is a full continental breakfast. staff at the desk (who was only who we interacted with this time) were pleasant and helpful. I would recommend this hotel for any stay. i've read about noise from airport but at least in our rooms you didn't unless you had the window open. the only thing i thought tacky (i also work for a name hotel/motel) is in the elevator they had a notice that when you receive your email survey to put all 10's there. whether or not someones low score is warrented, to ask otherwise is tacky. heck we like all 10's too lol. but anyways, great place to stay and the price is right. No there are no "shops" nearby but our reasoning was price! there is a bennagan's restuarant adjacent to the property for good food!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Volchik
Reviews.Content: Overall a pretty standard hotel. I'm very nitpicky about cleanliness and I did not find any problems with my room. The bed was comfortable and the room has a nice vanity area. The hotel is close to the airport and my room was near the elevator and vending machines so I was a little worried about noise but had a quiets nice rest. Check-in was easy and the front desk staff was very friendly. Due to traffic and that the hotel is a little tucked away behind the red roof inn and bennigans I had a little difficulty finding it even with a gps. The continental breakfast is pretty basic. Overall a good experience for an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay and Great personel”
Reviews.Author: Luv2BatC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise for one night. We had taken the "red eye" flight from the west coast and arrived at the hotel around 8 am. I really didn't expect to get our room at that time and asked if we could leave our luggage there until check in time. The clerk checked our reservation and to my supprise she said she had 1 room available, and allowed us to check in. What a God send, none of us were able to sleep on the plane and we were all wiped out. This was our second time staying at an LaQuinta Inn and won't be our last. Both times we received excellent service and always with a smile. I don't know how they go about training their personel but they do a great job. Much better than the treatment we received at Hampton Inns and others. The only "con" I can think of is that the eating area is waaaaaay to small.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: sallie101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to cruising out of Port of Miami. After reading some of the reviews on this hotel we were a little leery, however, it was very nice. It was clean, the staff was pleasant and easy to understand, the price was very nice and included a shuttle from airport to hotel and hotel to port. Breakfast was a little crowded, but there was plenty of food. We arrived late and we were hungry, there was a Bennigan's w/in walking distance which was also very good and reasonable. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MonsterInn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well in their installations, but I note the excellent service that the staff provides. Always smiling and ready to solve culaquier kind of need. The rates are adequate. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Its okay for one night but I probably wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: PoorTripPlanner
Reviews.Content: pretty basic LaQuinta --free shuttle from MIA and to Port of MIA is why we stayed. I will look for other options with the same shuttle/bfast option for my next precruise stay in Miami. I would only go back if nothing else is avail in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: xomanda
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my parents, younger sister, and grandparents, booking two rooms for a pre-cruise 5 day stay. When we stayed at the hotel, they were in the middle of renovating, so some rooms had the fresh 'paint-smell' to them. However, when asked, the front desk was willing to give us new rooms, trying to accommodate any requests we had. Some parts of the room, the sections 'less-travelled' were somewhat dusty, though. The location was fine if you had a car, as the only restaurant within walking distance was Bennigan's. The enterprise we rented from was just down the street which was very convenient for renting and returning the car (about 10 to 15 mins walk). The airport shuttle also proved very handy, as they were also willing to drive us to the enterprise to pick up the car on our first day (before we knew it was so close). The cruise shuttle was also very convenient, and very friendly when dropping us off. The driver of both shuttles, (which was actually the same bus) Dave, was very nice. The continental breakfast was average, with the usual selection of hard-boiled eggs, cereal, toast & bagels, some fruit, etc. and a self-serve waffle maker. They closed the breakfast at pretty much exactly the time they post, though, so don't be late!! =) The parking was alright, we managed to find an ok spot every day, sometimes going in the back door, and the wifi worked without any hassle as well. Our room also had a view of the pool, which we didn't use, but looked alright. All in all, the hotel was pretty good. If I went to Miami again, it would definitely be one of my top choices! P.S. When visiting Miami, remember to go to Joe's Stone Crab!!

Reviews.Title: “Good pre/post cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: PalmSpringsVisitors
Reviews.Content: We reserved two rooms for four family members before a cruise to the Bahamas. Arriving at the Miami airport at different times, we all took the free shuttle to the hotel. While there was delay in being picked up, the driver was courteous and the ride was comfortable. The hotel was very crowded, with many folks going to the cruise docks the next morning. With one exception, the staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was large with a king-size bed, microwave, and refrigerator. Overall, it was very clean but somewhat run-down and dingy. We walked to the nearby Bennigan's for dinner but should have paid attention to other reviewers. The service was friendly but very spotty, and the food was average to poor. However, there is little else within walking distance. The hotel's continental breakfast had the normal items and was plentiful; we were lucky to get a table as many families who arrived later had no where to sit. Although many people were taking the free shuttle to the docks, our ride was right on time, and we enjoyed the trip, getting to see a little of Miami. Be sure to make a reservation for the shuttle the night before! Two of us stayed at La Quinta for one night after the cruise, while the other two chose a Days Inn (NOT a good choice). Note that there is no free shuttle from the port to the hotel. Again, our room was clean but run-down. We had rented a car for sightseeing and so did not need the free shuttle back to the airport. There is a computer and printer in the lobby that I used for flight check-in at a small cost. I later found out from the front desk that I could have done that for free, but there were no signs at the computer indicating that service (annoying). I would recommend this budget hotel for its location to the airport, price, and shuttle services.

Reviews.Title: “Best Option Prior to Cruising”
Reviews.Author: Martin217
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night prior to our 7 day Caribbean cruise on carnivalâ€™s liberty, My wife and I got to Miami Airport at 6pm and called La Quinta so they could send the shuttle to pick us up, the hotel clerk advise me that the driver was out on break however we would not have to wait at all; she asked for my reservation and name, then told me to catch a blue taxi just outside the baggage claim terminal which is where we were, and tell the cab driver to take us to the hotel and make sure I ask for a receipt, that I would get reimbursed upon arrival at la Quinta, it was a ten minute ride and $10.00, I got my receipt from the driver went inside the hotel, inform the young lady at reception that I had arrive from the airport on a blue taxi, gave her my name and handed over the receipt, she said: yes weâ€™ve been waiting for you Sir and gave me my $10.00 on the spot. Check in was a breeze and reserve our transportation to the port the next day, the room was large with a king size bed and good size bathroom. We went to Burger King around 8pm we were starving, itâ€™s about a ten minute walk, I had read reviews about staying away from Bennighans so we did. We first walk next door to the Embassy Suites Hotel Restaurant but it was too expensive for us. Itâ€™s easy to get to Burger King, walk outside La Quinta to the access rd. and walk north along the side of the green fence of Embassy Suites parking lot then take a left at NW South River Walk Dr. under the overpass (walk against traffic) then a left again at NW 36th St. when you turn on 36th you will see it on 36th & 953 rd. thereâ€™s also a McDonalds if you keep going west on 36th but I estimated that it was like Â½ mile away. (No sidewalks all grass very safe). Next day we hit the continental breakfast at 9am there open from 7 to 10, great assortment of cereals, juices, milk, pastries, hard-boil eggs, fruit, coffee and waffles. The ride to the port was about 25 minutes and the shuttle is a mini bus, very comfortable. All in all this is a great hotel prior to cruising will definitely stay here again. By the way, if you work for the Government or are current or prior Armed Forces, police, fire department or Retired and have proof of it, you can get a great reduced stay for $65.00 a night at any Quinta, I did. PS never heard a single airplane.

Reviews.Title: “LaQuinta MIA Airport East - No frills economy hotel with free shuttle to cruise lines”
Reviews.Author: CaptainBly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this La Quinta hotel one night early the week of May 23, 2010 prior to embarking on a cruise departing from the Port of Miami. This hotel is an older property located near the MIA airport (a 3-4 minute shuttle ride). It is a modestly priced economy hotel featuring very basic amenities. "Basic" amenities include a free continental breakfast (waffles, hot & cold cereal, pastries, yogurt, coffee and orange juice), and an internet terminal near the front desk. The good news: The staff was friendly and the hotel offers free airport shuttle service every 30 minutes. In addition, they have a free shuttle to the Port of Miami for guests departing for cruise vacations. My room was clean and did not smell of cigarette smoke. The a/c was quiet and worked well, and there was basic cable television. The room rate was on the inexpensive side. The not-so-good news: There is only 1 (rather run down looking) restaurant in the immediate area around the hotel, and no shopping options. The television, telephone and light fixtures in the room were ancient and vaguely dingy. While this hotel could seriously use a remodeling job, it was adequate for a very inexpensive one night stay. I would only --nominally-- recommend to fellow travelers seeking a 1 night stay at a clean, no frills hotel near the MIA airport or departing for a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “free brekkie, shuttle to airport and cruise terminal but right under the flight path”
Reviews.Author: paulastaggs
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable for one night stay, easy to get to in a cab or using the free shuttle. Good value for money, we paid about AUD100 and there were 4 of us in the room! They have free breakfast and free shuttle to cruise terminal. The only thing is it is right underneath the flight path so you'll be up from 6am Most cabbies knew where it was using the street name (there are 2 La Quinta's at the airport).

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: NKOTB08
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of this location I was hesitant to stay, but the price was far under what I had budgeted so I just went with it. We flew into FLL and ported out of Miami, we had a rental car and were able to park it here for free during our cruise, they also offer a free shuttle to the port. The free shuttle alone saved us well over $50, when I returned to Miami I took a taxi back to pick up the rental, the cost was $27 plus tip. The location is older, however it was clean and not as noisy as I had read about. One of the ladies at the front desk did not go out of her way to help me, however the rest of the staff was friendly. I would not recommend using this locaton for a family vacation - I did not hear the airplanes in my room, but could not have a conversation at the pool because of the noise when they flew over. If you are just staying over night and need a cheap and clean place to sleep this is it. Also, there really is not much within walking distance, one restaurant in the parking lot - otherwise it's delivery or you'll need transportation. After reading the reviews and staying here I believe some people were expecting a 5* hotel at 2-3* prices.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta East comes through for us again!”
Reviews.Author: lambs2
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay the night before before a cruise out of the port of Miami at La Quinta East. However, this was the very first time we have had to pay extra to park our car there because our cruise was more than 7 days which has now become the maximum FREE car parking length allowed. Last year we had left our car parked in the lot there for THREE full weeks and there was no extra charge. Beyond the free seven days the parking charge is now $5. per day. Still a good deal, but not the GREAT deal we have experienced at La Quinta East in the past! We were fortunate to arrive at the hotel about 1:30 pm and there was no one in line at reception in front of us. Later in the afternoon I happened to walk by and the queue at the front desk was several layers deep and there were still only just the two women at reception who had been on duty when we checked in earlier. We felt very fortunate to have been able to register quickly when we arrived and were the very first names on the list for the earliest complimentary van to our cruise ship at the port the next morning. DO ask to be placed on the shuttle list for the port as you are registering as there is a limited number of seats available for each shuttle run. We booked one of the less expensive rooms with two beds near the front of the hotel on the 3rd floor. We have had the larger deluxe room in the past which has a fridge and a king sized bed, but his time we were using La Quinta points to pay for most of our room charges and the smaller was completely adequate for our one night pre-cruise stay. I spent the afternoon reading out by their very pleasant pool area while my husband watched sports upstairs in our room. We got up early the next morning and there was still plenty of room in the breakfast room downstairs - but not for long! We found the complimentary breakfast quite adequate and a great way to start our vacation! DH enjoys the make-your-own waffle station and I just had my usual oatmeal and a banana plus tea or coffee and juice. When we returned on a flight from Europe 19 days later we found the La Quinta East van waiting for passengers outside the 2nd floor of the airport above the baggage claim area with absolutely no need to call for the van. We were whisked back to La Quinta where we loaded our car, parked just as we left it, and drove the several hours home after a great vacation. We both highly recommend La Quinta East as a very convenient place to stay near the airport in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Free shuttles to the airport, cruise terminal, and free parking!”
Reviews.Author: weatherguy1
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta Inn & Suites at Miami Airport EAST on Le Jeune Road was a difficult motel to find, by car, especially arriving from the north. You have to make a U-turn and come back around on N. LeJeune road and exit on to the service road. Otherwise, check-in to the motel took an enormous amount of time. The motel front desk is severely under-staffed and needs more help there. The motel does have a FREE airport shuttle and also provides a FREE shuttle to the Port of Miami. We used both as we had a Trans-Atlantic cruise to get to. Parking in their parking lot is FREE, but ONLY for a period of 7 days. Beyond 7 days, you must pay $5 per day for parking. The parking lot does have cameras and security. We left our car there for a period of about 17 days, without incident. The room we were given which was 2 Queen beds was a small room, but the roomâ€™s condition was clean and orderly. The TV could have sat higher up, though. Surprisingly for the price we paid, there was NO refrigerator in our room. That was a disappointment! As for computers and the internet, there was one computer in the lobby, BUT you must pay about $0.50 cents per minute to use it for internet use â€“ an outrageous charge!! The FREE shuttle to the Port of Miami was behind schedule and didnâ€™t pick us up until late. We were scheduled to leave at 10 AM; instead we got to the Port of Miami at 12 noon. When flying back from Europe, the FREE shuttle bus to the airport came much quicker and we didnâ€™t even need to call for the shuttle bus; it arrives on the upper deck where departures are at; NOT where the arrivals are at, so take note of that! Just look for the wording on the shuttle bus that reads, â€œLa Quinta Inn EASTâ€� printed on the shuttle bus and flag them down. My only reason for recommending this motel is because they offer FREE parking for 7 days, FREE airport shuttle bus, and FREE cruise shuttle to the port of Miami. They do NOT offer a pick-up from the port back to the motel though. They did offer a FREE breakfast, which was limited in scope I thought, but I believe I later learned they had waffles, which I didnâ€™t see at first.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star Service at 3-Star Price -- Great Stop on the Way to Your Cruise!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyvale_steve
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for someone who is arriving in Miami the day/night before a cruise and needs a convenient place to stay. The hotel includes free airport shuttle (until 11pm?) and free cruise port transfer (from hotel to cruise port only, as far as I know). Breakfast is also included -- basically toast, cereal, waffles, coffee, and juice. This was everything I needed. The rooms are very clean. The only possible negative is that it's extremely close to the airport so you will hear the planes taking off unless you keep your room air conditioner running. This was not an issue for me. The staff is incredibly helpful. We needed to go out to buy some things that we forgot for our cruise. The desk clerk (can't remember her name, sorry) not only offered advice on where to go but also offered to pay for the taxi! I don't know if this is typical of all La Quinta Inns but I was very impressed by this level of service and will definitely be giving them my business in the future. This hotel has everything you need when passing through Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, courteous atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: shirl369marmol
Reviews.Content: First of all, the rooms were very clean and comfortable, and secure. I felt very safe. But most of all, the staff was very friendly, courteous, and very accommodating from the very beginning (Raquel, and Mari). The location was fine, (a little noisy because of the airplanes). The free wi-fi was great and useful as well as the free breakfast. I would definitely recommend to everyone, especially for people families/tourists not familliar with the area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Miami cruise port, close to airport and highway, but quiet!”
Reviews.Author: chicagoheroine
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here the night before a cruise. Caught the free shuttle from the MIA airport to the hotel. Check in was easy and the front desk was very nice. We signed up for the free cruise port shuttle at that time. Room was average for a La Quinta. The blankets were a little spare and were tucked down really low. We were right by the highway and near the airport, but it was really quiet! There was a Bennigans within walking distance which was nice because there was no restaurant at the hotel. Breakfast was very busy in the morning. A queue was starting and people just started going into it, except it was only for the toasters! It was hard to tell though because the food was in a little room away from the seating. The free shuttle to the cruise port was great. If we take another cruise out of Miami, I would definately choose this hotel again. I have had really good luck with La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very clean”
Reviews.Author: jimBethlehem_pa_
Reviews.Content: Get the shuttle at the airport on the second (upper) level for the motel. Give them a time for the shuttle to the pier when you check in. Breakfast room is very small. you can always take your breakfast to your room. The price is right. Please DON'T eat at the Bennighan's restaurant just outside the motel. First of all we detected a musty and badf odor when we walked in. My wife and I went there mistakingly and sat at a booth and ordersd our drinks. Then along came one of the house ROACHES strolling across our table. Well, I just let out a loud La coocaracha and the hispanics and others knew right away that we had uninvited guests. Needless to say, we got up and let our displeasure known while walking out. We then went to the Embassy suites (paid a little more) and had a delicious meal. It was well worth it! Good luck and beware of the Bennigan's.

Reviews.Title: “no frills value”
Reviews.Author: JuanitaDubois
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta because ... When we planned our cruise we needed a place to stay before and after the cruise. After reading hundreds of reviews for $50-$500 rooms, I came to the conclusion that they all had good reviews and bad review now matter what was paid. Originally we chose Regency Airport Hotel Miami and were very disappointed. We saw a add on a Miami tv channel and I breifly remembered reading reviews so we cancelled our after cruise booking and booked at La Quinta. Firstly, we saw no bugs. This is a biggy for me, the last thing I want to do after a vacation is fumigare our luggage. The pool was nice and I enjoyed sitting out watching the planes come off the runway. That being said if you don't want to hear them 24/7 this is not the hotel for you. The breakfast was basic, make your own waffles, toast, muffin or cold cereal. On the second day fresh fruit was aslo available. The rooms were basic, nothing fancy, but the beds were comfortable. We found that the value was in having free airport shuttle ( $25 for a cab) and free port miami shuttle ( again $25.00 for a cab) , the convience of having breakfast there ( a $30 value for our family of 3) The room paid for itself. However every time we asked for something we were referred to go to the hotel next to us ( Embassy Suites) . When we walked over to this hotel we were blown away! The concierge told us that should we want a room go to hotwire and put a bid in as they have ppl staying there for $80 a night all the time, we will do this the next time we are in Miami!!!) Lastly, if your a avid non smoker, don't go to this hotel. Our daughter is a severe asthmatic and we had to check out early because someone was smoking on our floor (both nights) and would leave their door open to the hallway. Our daughter was congested and we had to leave. When we told them at the Front Desk the girl said it happens often and there is nothing they can do about it. There is a smoking section to the hotel on a different floor and another section of the premisis but they have no recourse. We are from Canada and a trip to the emergency room was something we wanted to avoid, so we had to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Very upsetting stay.”
Reviews.Author: trista762
Reviews.Content: We checked into this the day before we were leaving on a cruise out of miami. Since this hotel was referred to us by a friend and we were also told that they will allow you to park your vehicle there for up to 2 wks free and a free shuttle to the ship we decided to try it out. That was a mistake! The room had an awful stale musty odor, the T.V didn't work so I called the front desk only to be told that I needed to turn it off & on which didn't work I was then told to make sure the game system that they have was unplugged and that also didn't work. They still offered to send no one so I gave up and began taking everything off the tv (wires) and replacing them again, apparently one was loose because I got it working. UGH! The continental breakfast was ok (the waitress that refilled and cleaned up was fantastic) but it was very crowded and not nearly enough seating. At breakfast (7 am) we spoke to the front desk to remind them we had a stroller, a scooter for my elderly grandmother and all 5 of us had 1 large piece of luggage and 1 carry on each in which they assured us that it was no problem to get a van large enough to transport all of us. When the van finally came (9:30am) we were told the small scooter now doesn't fit so we could leave it and my 93 yr. old grandmother until they would have an empty van at 1pm?! WHAT?! My mother was going to wait with the scooter and get brought to the boat at 1pm and we loaded all the luggage and the driver then said the stroller won't fit now either because he had another large family with all of their stuff so ours all can't fit. He said we would have to leave it also. Well I can't leave my mom with her luggage, a scooter, and a stroller so I did get a bit aggravated and just told the driver to unload ALL of our things and we will all just wait together for the 1 pm van. I did return back inside to ask the lady that seemed to be a supervisor what happened since we signed up to be shuttled the day before at check in and we also told them then what we had to be taken and was again told it wouldn't be a problem. All I could get from her was an I'm sorry, she did not even try to get us on the next van/bus. We ended up taking a taxi for $30 to the pier just to get out of the hotel. The cruise was nice and it cost $30 for the return trip to the hotel so we could pick up our vehicles which we were sure to park under lighting AND IN THEIR CAMERA VIEW before we left! None the less my Armada was keyed down the whole driver door! This was a good idea if it worked out smoothly. If you do try this hotel and have ANY of the above issues I've mentioned be very cautious! None of us will ever stay at this hotel again nor do we have anything good to say about it. I am sure that there are plenty of other hotels in the close proximity of the port that would be happy to have our business and much better hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights, perfect for pre-cruise stay. Had minor problem with reservations, manager resolved it immediately. Nothing within walking distance. Shuttle to Port of Miami went flawlessly. Noisy til about 9:30 then flights slow down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...Great Service”
Reviews.Author: delta765
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the La quinta on before my Cruise and one after and they could not have been more helpful and competent in getting me from the Airport to the Hotel to the Port and back to the Airport...the room was nice, clean and available when thet said it would be...the shuttle service was first rate...and they even told me how to get to a Rental Car Co. with just a short walk (10 min.) it is the place to stay if you are going to cruise or just need a location with free shuttle near the Airport. By the way Carnival will NEVER EVER get me on one of their ships again...but that is a different review!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are going a cruise.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaLovinlife
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed one night before leaving for our cruise. I didn't know much about Miami so I went by the reviews I had read about this hotel and I'm glad that I did. The hotel was really clean and the staff was very nice. We live 9 hours from Miami so coming in the day of the cruise was not an option for us. The room cost was a little of $100 and we were gauranteed a shuttle to the Port and were allowed to leave out car in their parking lot at not extra charge. Parking at the Port would have cost us around $100 so I think we did good. We will stay here again for our next cruise.

Reviews.Title: “If cruising from Miami this is a great, inexpensive choice.”
Reviews.Author: Leisure_Traveler37
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay the night before a cruise this is a great choice. It's inexpensive and shuttles run to/from the airport and to the port of Miami. We did not have to wait for either shuttle. The staff is friendly and the rooms are nice. Our room had a very comfortable chair (in addition to a desk chair). There is some jet noise but the name of the hotel should alert you to that. Only one restaurant in walking distance â€“ Benniganâ€™s. Really no place else to walk. Breakfast is standard serve yourself fare. Staying at a place for a week this may not be a good choice but for an overnight and a ride to the port it canâ€™t be beat.

Reviews.Title: “best airport location”
Reviews.Author: applepics
Reviews.Content: perfect location to leave your car. 89 dollars for great room and service. shuttle service good. breakfast good for the price[free}.

Reviews.Title: “couple problems, but a great place for a budget stay”
Reviews.Author: tink360
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night pre-cruise, after getting into miami around 10pm. We did not use the airport shuttle because my friend wanted to get a rental car. The place looked decent from the outside, although the was a lengthy wait at check in - they could use more people at the check in desk at that hour. Also they had no smoking room available even though I had made a reservation specifying smoking several months before. The room was very clean, the carpet could use shampooing but all the hard surfaces in the room & bathroom were very clean. One big problem, no cold water from the sink. The only sink was not in the bathroom - it was located at a vanity outside the bathroom. Not a big problem but the faucet was broken and only would run hot water. I called the front desk - no one would answer (probably because they were so swamped), took the elevator back down to the lobby to report the problem. They were full so could not put us in a different room. Someone came up to the room but as I expected, could not repair it. They did give me some bottled water & the manager took 20% off the bill the next day - they have decent customers service, not just for a budget hotel but for any hotel period. Not the place to stay if this is the base for your miami vacation, but if it is just a short stay before a cruise or flight out - it's clean, quiet and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: viajantemanaus
Reviews.Content: If you want to catch a plane this hotel is perfect, because is just 5 minutes to Airport. The rooms are clean, nice and the hotel has a Free Breakfast with Cereals, rolls, toast, juice, muffins etc. There's Free High Speed Internet and Free shuttle too, but the shuttle works at 6 am to 11 pm. There is a Bennigan's Restaurant is within walking distance. This is very good, especially when you are without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to start our trip.”
Reviews.Author: sassycatsmama
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place close to the airport as our flight came in very late and we just wanted to sleep before heading out on the rest of our trip. We picked this up on HotWire.com for $39 plus tax. The room was small but very clean and quite adequate for a one night stay. The continental breakfast offered boiled eggs, yogurt, toast, bagels, waffles, hot and cold cereal, coffee, milk, juice, etc. The breakfast room was clean and organized but remember that they close EXACTLY on time so get there early enough to get what you need. The desk staff was very helpful. I would also recommend this hotel if you are coming in and need to stay the night before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: MCC2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Quinta Inn based on reviews from tripadvisor and cruisecritic. We booked a one night pre-cruise stay in August 2009. We got a summer discount code and got a room for $55 plus tax. The main reason we booked this hotel is because the hotel has complimentary shuttle service from the Miami airport to the hotel and from the hotel to the Port of Miami. Since our flight landed in the afternoon, we didn't want to rent a car just for the evening. After arriving at Fort Lauderdale airport, we took the TRI-RAIL to Miami airport. From there, we used the complimentary shuttle to get to the hotel and then to the port the next day. We waited 40 minutes for the shuttle to come pick us up from the airport after our call to the hotel. This was the only negative of our stay. We got on the 9:30 a.m. bus to the port and arrived at the port after about 30 minutes. The hotel was dated but our room was clean. We also used the pool facility. Internet service was provided free of charge. It can be a bit noisy, especially outside of the hotel, with the close proximity to the airport. However, we were able to catch a good night's rest. The Bennigan's restaurant next door is open and is within a short walking distance. There are no other attractions or facilities close to the hotel. The hotel offered a complimentary breakfast starting from 7:00 a.m. The staffs were friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for night before cruise”
Reviews.Author: 2bytheshore
Reviews.Content: We flew into Ft. Lauderdale and stayed here for a night before a cruise departure in Miami. Inlaws met us there and drove to hotel. In the morning we choose to take a cab ($28.00 for 4 of us including tip) to Miami because we couldn't get on the shuttle until 12:00. Just remember when you check in to immediately make your reservation for the shuttle to the port. They didn't tell us this until later in the day. By that time it was pretty much filled up for the morning departures. This hotel is perfect for a night's stay. Nice staff, clean rooms, free parking (up to 2 weeks), breakfast and shuttle to miami port. Would highly recommend. Much cheaper than the hotels in Miami and you can't beat free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle made travel so much easier.”
Reviews.Author: bookmommy0406
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise. The shuttle from the airport and then to the port made it so convenient. The desk staff were very friendly, they recommended a Cuban restaurant that delivers--delicious food! This is not a luxury hotel by any means, but was clean and perfectly adequate for a stay before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Pick up from Airport and Drop off at Port of Miami was great”
Reviews.Author: DavinaRM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading a review about the hotel pick up and drop off. Got the AAA price of 65 plus tax. The beds were very comfortable. They were clean. The floor however could have used a good vacuuming under the bed. The bathroom could have used a good cleaning too. The breakfast was good. The air conditioning worked. The hotel was full yet we never heard any commotion. The staff was friendly however the front desk wasn't all that helpful when we wanted to find a market to purchase some water for our upcoming cruise. Sort of felt like I was being talked down to. Maybe it was just a difference in cultures. I read there was a market close. We found a market after a one way cab ride of $8.00.... There was one restaurant next door. Maybe if it wasn't so hot we would have ventured further.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Leo_CK
Reviews.Content: We picked up a room saver coupon magazine on our way from orlando to miami and decided to try this hotel for USD49.00 plus tax. It was quite a pleasant stay, the room size is avergage and includes a table, iron and TV, no microwave or fridge but you got restaurants and a market just a few steps away if you need to eat lunch or dinner.. Breakfast was included (coffee, tea bread, apple and orange juice, chocolate, cinnamon and banana muffins, waffles and fruits) air conditioning always worked fine, free parking and their airport shuttle service is ok, the staff was always friendly. Could not try the pool but it looked fine. If you plan to stay in a non expensive place I would definetly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Money”
Reviews.Author: pacerzfan
Reviews.Content: Was not perfect as elevator had issues during stay. Room was very adaquate. Stay away from any "deals" at pizza places slipped under door, as most are a rip off I found out.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for short stay”
Reviews.Author: jayarrscott
Reviews.Content: We (2 60+grandparents, daughter & partner and grandson aged 12) stayed here for 2 nights after flying in to Miami before driving down to Key West for our other daughter's wedding. The rooms were spacious, clean and very comfortable and acted as a good base for crashing out after a long flight from London and a day at South Beach. We didn't use the pool (although it looked ok). Although we noticed aircraft flying low to/from the nearby airport, good soundproofing meant it didn't bother us in our rooms. Breakfast was good, although there really wasn't enough space for all there. We ate well at Embassy Suites next door using the bar menu - this appeared to be the only decent restaurant within walking distance.. Make sure you have a good map - we found it not easy to find first time. Overall a very good value short stay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: westsussex10
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this hotel, the floors at the reception/communal areas were quite dirty, which was a very poor first impression, though fortunately when we got to our room that was ok. We spent the first day at Miami Beach and were gone from 8 till 5, despite this our room had not been cleaned on return. We had to phone to request for a maid to come, then move out of the room again so it could be done. Insufficient towels were supplied on both days. The hotel offers services that it doesn't provide. The free high speed internet in our room did not work for our 2 night stay, the signal said either "none" or "low". The free USA today did not appear on the 2nd morning, I went to reception 3 times to ask for it (this was a weekday) and was told it "hadn't been delivered" that day. The nearest ice machine was broken throughout our stay. We booked this Miami Airport La Quinta, because of issues with crime (as reported on Trip Advisor) at the one we had originally booked. However at checkout a guest came to the lobby to report his car had been broken into overnight with items stolen, he requested the staff called 911, and was very frustrated with their slow response.

Reviews.Title: “No smoking should mean No smoking”
Reviews.Author: cprsailor
Reviews.Content: This La Quinta is very conveniently located to the Miami International Airport. It's a good place to stay as a place to spend the night between flights or before a cruise but there is not enough around to make it really useful as a base for a Miami vacation. Our check-in was quick and pleasant. The biggest problem was that our non-smoking room wreaked of smoke. Even the hallway smelled of smoke. The only reason I didn't request a new room was because we arrived late and I have two small children who were falling asleep. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean though a bit on the small side. The breakfast was adequate and plentiful. If I was looking for a place to spend the night around MIA I would stay here again but I would insist on a different room if the one I had smelled of smoke like this one did.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sumada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start and end of our trip to Key West, FL because we flew into and out of Miami For the price it was a fine hotel. The rooms were clean, actually so clean I was surprised! It is pretty much right next to the airport, so airplanes were landing and taking off all day. They have a free airport shuttle and our car rental place ended being right next door to them at the Embassy Suites. Of course, it's a few miles from the beaches, but if you are flying in and out of Miami and off to another destination or a cruise, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MEXTRIPS
Reviews.Content: Great location, fast free airport shuttle, free internet, clean rooms with amazing beds and pillows, free parking, gentle staff, check in and check out at very convenient hours and very worthy for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms, Great For Pre Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Solaris1
Reviews.Content: Our cruise group stayed here prior to sailing this past Sat (2/23) and despite some of the bad reviews on here we were very pleased with our accomodations. My room was very very clean & appeared to have a fresh coat of paint. The bathroom was spotless, very clean with no hair on the floor or in the tub, toilet & other fixtures were also very clean. The hotel is located literaly right next to the airport and we did hear planes up till about midnight but after that we didnt hear much. Keep in mind that the hotel can only be entered driving Northbound on LeJeune Rd. The only thing I thought could use a little improvement was the breakfast area. There were very few tables to sit at, they need to add more tables. The breakfast offerings were fresh fruits, yougurts, oatmeal, bagles & waffles. For the price of $89. I think we got a great deal. Keep in mind that there are no places to eat or shop at in walking distanc to this hotel. Even by car there is not much around here. But it is good for a pre cruise stay where you only need a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: jboogie26
Reviews.Content: i enjoy staying here at la quinta inn.. the rooms are nice and the people are friendly

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dempsey_Family08
Reviews.Content: For a one night stay it was more than adequate. Nice staff, clean and comfortable, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good to spend the night”
Reviews.Author: aRTie81
Reviews.Content: For my three-week trip to Florida including 5 days in Miami I looked at multiple hotels, preferable for less than 100$/night. Turning to TripAdvisor a lot of hotels were eliminated, add the driving distance to Florida City and Homestead, it became a short list and I made my reservation via the internet. I arrived around 9:30PM and found everything prepared for checkin. The room was clean, although a new carpet and some new paint in typical "hit me with a suitcase"-areas could improve the overall quality. I had a 2nd-floor room facing the airport and at first felt a lot of discomfort with the aircraft taking off and landing - it was clearly audible and I can not agree with others who claim they can barely be heard. However, I found air traffic to be slow to inexistent between 10PM and 6AM, which was good enough for me. I only came to spend the night, not stay at the hotel all day (which does have a pool surrounded by palm trees - probably a great place if you're looking for a tan and spotting aircraft at the same time). I did not take advantage of the free breakfast. Wireless LAN was available in both rooms I stayed in (beginning of trip and end of trip), although it was a little weak at times. An ATM and vending machines are available near the lobby. Sufficient parking is available outside. During my second stay, I found the in-room coffee maker to be broken, I received an immediate 10% compensation at the front desk! The hotel offers an airport shuttle, however, if you travel without a car you may find yourself looking for a place to eat, there are no restaurants immediatly around the property - I did find several flyers advertising food delivery under my door every evening though. If you are arriving by car, note that the property can only be entered driving northbound! Summary: good place to stay, you get what you pay for. If you're prepared to drive around town this is a good choice, if you're looking for beach and water, look for something closer to the water.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: luvNY94
Reviews.Content: We just needed a hotel before our cruise because we were flying in the day before. We looked at both Fort Lauderdale and Miami hotels and reviews (we flew into FLL, but our ship was docked at the Port of Miami). Hotels in both cities were around the same price, but most of the reviews for Fort Lauderdale hotels were pretty bad, so we opted for this one. It was a little bit pricey ($100), considering it was just a very basic hotel, but it did the job. Everything was average, but we have no complaints. Things worked the way they should, the room was clean enough, and the staff was cordial enough. Not bad for a one-night stay before our vacation officially started.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay for a cruise”
Reviews.Author: RalphNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night before our cruise. La Quinta Inn picked us up at the airport, and the next day drove us to our cruise ship for no cost. This service was great. The cost from the cruise ship back to the airport was $30.00. The hotel is a great savings. We had to order out for our dinnerm since the Hotel serves no lunch or dinner, but there a tables to eat at the hotel. There our a number of pizza restaurants that deliver. The next morning the Hotel gives a great breakfast for free. The Hotel is clean and the front desk is very helpful. Being close to the airport means you will hear planes, but was still able to get a good nights sleep. Hey, for the first time, after we were in our room for about a half hour, the front desk called, asked if our room was OK and that if we needed anything, just give them a call. They are there 24 hours a day. The rooms are plain and the bed was very good. I asked some other guests what they thought and all agreed that this is the place to stay for a night when you have a cruise the next day. NJ Ralph

Reviews.Title: “Good airport stopover place”
Reviews.Author: sfuhere
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night pre-flight. It's very near the airport, although located down a slightly out of the way road, possibly not the easiest hotel to find if you're driving. However, we're British and were driving around Miami for the first time - at night - and we managed it, so it can't be that difficult! I thought this was rather an nice place actually. Comparing it to a Comfort Inn, where we had stayed previously, this seemed more upmarket. The room was bigger and the bathroom was too. There was more choice at the breakfast buffet. I don't think anyone should stay here for an actual holiday, but this is designed as a stopover place, and I think it performs that role perfectly well. There's a big car park also.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back.”
Reviews.Author: becky3128
Reviews.Content: Me, my boyfriend, and two other couples stayed at this hotel before boarding a cruise ship the next day. The only good thing I have to say is that the breakfast was good. The front desk staff was rude. One of the only reasons we booked there was the free shuttle to the port, the front desk employee told us he couldn't guarantee we could get on the shuttle. There was barely anyone staying there! The rest of our trips to the desk we were treated rudely. The rooms were semi clean but outdated and we could hear people in the rooms around us. You definitely get what you pay for but I would not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel before cruise, scary location”
Reviews.Author: lucyaf
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here before leaving on a cruise out of the port of Miami. The only reason we stayed at the La Quinta was because of the free shuttle to the port. I arrived before my boyfriend around 4:00pm. My taxi driver coming from the Ft. Lauderdale airport laughed when I told him where I was staying, as did the Miami businessman who was sharing the cab with me. They both warned me that the location was dangerous and the area was really run-down. Also, that there was NOTHING near the hotel. Needless to say, I was really nervous checking in, since my boyfriend would not be arriving until very late in the night. Check-in was smooth. The hotel is dated, and there was a boarded up restuarant in the front. There is also a boarded up Bennigans next door. Basically, the only near-by dining option was the restaurant inside the Embassy Suites which was a five minute walk away. Their restaurant was a little pricey with entrees starting at $20.00. I was not going to pay that to eat at a hotel restaurant the day before going on a cruise! I opted to have pizza delivered to my room (which was was awful!) Looking back on it, I would have requested the shuttle to take me back to the Miami airport to eat. My boyfriend arrived later, and also remarked about the run-down, scary location. We grabbed a quick bit to eat in the morning, then got on the shuttle to the port. I realize that anyway near an airport is probably going to be a little shady, but next time I would pay the extra money to stay somewhere nicer. It met the needs of a place to stay with the free shuttle...

Reviews.Title: “Basic budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fahrrader
Reviews.Content: Can't understand all the complaints about this hotel. It is a basic, budget hotel. Don't expect luxury, but it is a basic, good, clean place to shower and sleep. If that's all you want, as we did while waiting to fly out to Peru, then this place is fine. I wouldn't want to spend a week's vacation here, but as a stopover for an airport transfer, this place fits the bill. It's perfectly clean and safe, with not a lot of noise. We found the front desk staff to be friendly and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep-shower-Leave”
Reviews.Author: Lucas5915
Reviews.Content: We had to deliver our rental car at Dollar and after that fly from Miami Airport. This LQ-motel was closeby and had a very reasonable price ($95). It was also close to the rental-car-returns (8 minutes walk). That was the main reasons for us to book this hotel. In other reviews people are making remarks on the noise (staff, planes), but I did not notice that at all. As the most airport hotels: sleep, shower, leave. Nothing more, nothing less. The ladies behind the counter (one was called Evy) were extremely nice and friendly, just as the guy driving the shuttle-bus.

Reviews.Title: “We will look for better options next time...”
Reviews.Author: want2c
Reviews.Content: We were flying out the next day and the La Quinta Miami Airport East is just good enough for that and nothing more. On our way back through Miami, we found another option at the same price that blows this place out of the water. The beds are ok and unless you donâ€™t mind waking up a couple of times at night by people talking outside your window and door, I recommend staying on the second floor as the staff remains pretty active into the early hours of the morning and they donâ€™t use their â€œinside voices.â€� The noise of planes taking off from the airport is also noticeable due to the thin walls. The morning breakfast provided by the hotel is a Running of the Bulls experience short on seating and food.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for One Night Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: LynnThomas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre-cruise. This is a low budget hotel, don't expect more. Room basic, basic no toiltrees. Carpet worn and stained in places. When I entered the room I thought, please just let it be clean. When I entered the bathroom, I saw hairs in the tub. Thank goodness we only stayed one night, otherwise I would have checked out. Free breakfast consisted of make your own toast, waffles. Cereal, milk, yogurt, juice, coffee. The fruit was all gone when I arrived for breakfast and one lady proceeded to take all of the hard boiled eggs. Who eats 6 boiled eggs!! Pros -- Free shuttle transportation from the airport to the hotel and free shuttle from the hotel to the Port of Miami, included. Next door to Bennigans restuarant (great drinks). Cheapest hotel I could find for one night in Miami ($89.00) Most hotels wanted over $150.00. I guess you get what you pay for. Red Roof Inn was next door and Embassy Suites.....

Reviews.Title: “for a stopover only”
Reviews.Author: lanche21
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok. Nothing more. The service was adequate, but the location was not good at all. There were several other hotels that would have been just as close with better room. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Serves its purpose for the night before a cruise.”
Reviews.Author: BearsFan917
Reviews.Content: I had read other reviews about the great shuttle to and from the airport. We only needed it from the airport, and called upon our arrival in Miami. We were told to just stand outside by departures and the shuttle would be by. We asked about a specific place and they said just outside anywhere by departures. So we stood outside. FOR AND HOUR!!!! We saw the hilton shuttle 3 times, the marriott twice, the red roof inn twice and even the LaQuinta west once along with countless other hotels but no LaQuinta East. We called 3 times and were told it would be there shortly. It did finally show up. It was a crappy van, but we didn't care it was finally here. So we walked up, and were told sorry they were full, we'll be back in 30 minutes. I thought, Jeez!!!, forget this dumb shuttle. So we took a cab which ended only costing a flat rate of $10 for all 5 of us, and it only took 5 minutes to get there. Should have done that in the first place. Anyways the rest of the stay was great. Check in was a breeze, the hotel served its purpose as we were staying the night before our cruise the next morning. The room was nice and the beds comfortable. The shuttle to the cruise ship was great (By far the best feature). We went to the Marlins game that night, and cab was $50 each way. I would stay away from the Bennigan's next door. I eat at Bennigan's all the time, and love the restaurant, but this one was dirty and had very poor service. No internet at this hotel, we were told to go to the Red Roof Inn next door. We should have used there shuttle too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place overnight before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: bambam26
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 boys stayed here the night before our cruise and it was perfect. They picked us up at the airport and took us to the port in the morning. The pool was adequate. The only downside was there was only one restaurant within walking distnace of the hotel, Bennigan's, so we had pizza delivered for lunch and had dinner there since we had no car. We would defintiely stay here again if we took another cruise out of Miami port.

Reviews.Title: “hhmm could be better”
Reviews.Author: spadge
Reviews.Content: Myself husband and 7 yo daughter stayed here for one night 2nd April 2008. We picked this hotel as we needed onenight near to airport as we arrived late evening and didnt want to drive to orlando until the next day. Room seemed tired shabby and not that clean it also had a smokey smell. Bfast was ok but nothing special , staff a bit off hand but we generally experienced rather off hand folk in Miami ! It suited our purpose for one night but its not a place we would return too.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Reporter
Reviews.Content: My daughter, granddaughter and I stayed at this hotel prior to a cruise out of Miami. I always read reviews on TripAdvisor website before I book a hotel, especially in Miami, because they vary widely, and trusted the positive reviews. We were just delighted with this hotel. The rooms were very nicely furnished and didn't seem like a budget hotel. We enjoyed the pool and the breakfast. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The best part was the price was very reasonable, hard to find in Miami. I would enthusiastically recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location but quite noisy”
Reviews.Author: powei
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotels for two nights before the Bahama cruise . The reason I chose this hotel is its great location. we rent a car to visit Everglade nation park the day before the cruise. it is very close to many car rental companys, enterprise car rental office is within walking distance . we took the enterprise shuttle from the airport to rent the car upon arriving Miami at 10: 30pm . it only take 2 minute drive from enterprise office to the hotel. there is a good restaraunt right next door and its kitchen closed at 12am . if you arrive late in Miami and just want a one night stay . this hotel will be a good choice. We had a room on 4th floor for the first night. it was a horrible experience. The airplanes were flying over our room every 5 min from 6 am. we can hear the the thunderstorm very loud at night too.( I think the insulation under the roof is way too thin) I requested to switch to 2nd floor next morning. I had much better sleep the 2nd night but you can still hear the airplane noise though. the breakfast is quite good , waffle, bagle ,yogurt and boil eggs , juice coffee, milk cerel. the shuttle to the Miami port came right on time( 11; 15 am ). it is free and you have to register when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a one nighter”
Reviews.Author: JWestShuh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a clean hotel for one night prior to taking a cruise out of the Port of Miami. We drove from Georgia and after reading reviews here we decided to go for it. We were pleased with our accommodations. It is a bit hard to find and tucked far from the road, so if you are driving, make sure to get directions before hand. We arrived around 8 pm to a nice clean room. We didn't use the pool or eat their breakfast in the morning - but it did look like it had a nice variety of items. The hotel provides you with a free transfer to the Port of Miami via a large bus. I think we left around 10am if memory serves. We felt very safe parking and leaving our car for 9 days (with no extra charge of course). When we returned our car was just as we left it. The only item that dropped the rating from Excellent to Above Average was the plane noise. I knew it was basically next to the airport so I was expecting this - but it was a bit noisier than I had imagined - I don't do much traveling by air. If you are wanting a nice hotel for pre/post cruise or flight, don't delay in booking at La Quinta.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Miami Airport East
HotelInfo.Address: 3501 Northwest Le Jeune Rd, Miami, FL 33142
